Every time I hear Karen Carpenter 's voice , there is that old familiar feeling of 70 's blues . , which transports me back to an era filled with simple, poignant melodies and heartfelt emotions. Her sultry, smooth, and angelic voice speaks to my soul, echoing tales of love, longing, and sadness wrapped in harmonious grace. With her soothing, emotional, and down-to-earth tones, she stands as a symbol of a time where love songs meant to touch you to the very core, and meant the very same things, regardless of race or background.

I saw Chomps during the - approximately - 2 days of its theatrical release . It is a delightfully cute film, but it had an extremely limited release which left me feeling somewhat lucky to have caught it on the big screen. Chomps tells the tale of a lovable robot dog and the wacky adventures that ensue. The mix of humor and heartwarming moments was genuinely enjoyable, and I found myself quickly becoming attached to this little animated character. The voice cast delivered stellar performances, further breathing life into this endearing, albeit short-lived cinematic gem.

MCBOING BOING is one of the cartoons that have stuck in my head over the years and finally decided to revisit it recently. Upon re-watching the series, it has become even more enjoyable with its nostalgic and timeless appeal. This bizarre yet fascinating tale revolves around the character Gerald McBoing Boing, a unique child with a penchant for communicating through various sound effects rather than words. This creative story breaks boundaries, and ultimately becomes a classic representation of celebrating one's own quirks and individuality. Overcoming obstacles through genuine human connections, McBoing Boing brilliantly delivers a refreshing dose of imagination and innovation to the realm of cartoons.

Together with the even more underrated , The Sun Shines Bright , Wagon Master was one of Ford 's favorite films, often considered as the pinnacle of his Western creations. Set against the vast and harsh landscape of the American frontier, Wagon Master is an emotional and visually captivating portrayal of life, struggle, and companionship on a perilous journey. The plot revolves around a diverse group of settlers, each seeking a new life and chasing their own unique dreams, as they join forces to traverse the treacherous terrain on their shared wagon train.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time, yet somehow, I keep getting drawn back into it, as if by some magnetic pull. It's as if the creators had the perfect recipe for mediocrity combined with an insidious addiction factor that I can't seem to escape. The cheesy dialogue, one-dimensional characters, and frustratingly predictable storylines are infuriating to no end. Still, I find myself cringing my way through every painful, drawn-out episode as the sheer boredom from the experience momentarily staves off reality.

In my opinion dads army is thee best British sitcom of all time . I believe that if you just give it a chance, it will instantly capture your heart with its wonderful mix of humor, character dynamics, and a touch of historical relevance. The show perfectly balances comedic moments with heartwarming storylines and lovable characters, each with their distinct personalities that wonderfully contribute to the comedic experience. Furthermore, Dad's Army portrays the courageous spirit of Britain during World War II, as the ragtag group of home guard members demonstrate determination, wit, and resilience.

Most of these reviews are dead on , so I 'll cut to a different chase and answer a couple of common questions. Firstly, the installation process is seamless and user-friendly, so you'll have no trouble getting started. Secondly, compatibility issues have been minimal; this works with most platforms and devices, so there shouldn't be any hindrances. The user interface is intuitive and simple, allowing both newbies and experienced users to navigate it with ease. Performance-wise, it's impressive with minimal glitches and crashes. In terms of support, the response time is prompt and customer care staff is knowledgeable.

One of the best ! As being a fan of the civil war , I was very pleased with the accuracy and attention to detail in this piece. It not only captures the essence of that tumultuous period in American history but also delves deeper into the personal stories and experiences of the people involved, on both sides of the conflict. From the powerful emotions of loss and despair to moments of victory and resilience, this work offers a fresh perspective on the Civil War while remaining true to its core. Moreover, it brilliantly highlights the key aspects that shaped the nation and contributed to its current social and cultural dynamics.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be a horror movie. The true story of a guy who's infatuated with pictures and got scared when he identified himself unexpectedly with one of them. The unbelievable story of A GUY who got scarier when the female-hero was deluding herself as well as the male-villain. Gosh, is this what life made us be? People deluding themselves about the perfect face imagining how that face should be perfect inside? "Toto, I think we're not in Kansas anymore".

Well , I 'm a few days late but what the hell .... ! Anyways , the word that best describes this past week has to be "rollercoaster." It's been a mix of ups and downs, from work projects taking unexpected turns, to catching up with old friends and rekindling connections. To top it all off, I've started diving into new hobbies and challenges - an attempt at breaking out of my comfort zone. Despite the chaos, I can't deny that I'm actually enjoying this whirlwind of events.

When I watch a short like Boy-Next-Door, I find myself with a kind of bittersweet feeling. On the one hand, I'm happy. I'm watching something that has been well thought out, seamlessly executed and just daring enough to be interesting. On the other hand I find myself lamenting the level of comedy generally produced. TV and films are so consistently packed with easy, condescending crap that we find ourselves judging excellence within a scale of mediocrity. Then you see someone like Davis, who, without the "benefit" of studio notes or substantial budget; can create a really cool little comic gem.

`` Side Show '' is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures . Very gory , and bizarre, "Side Show" takes the viewer on a twisted journey through a haunted carnival, filled with terrifyingly eerie characters and macabre scenes. Full Moon Pictures is renowned for their outlandish content and unforgettable storylines, and "Side Show" certainly does not disappoint in this regard. Set against a sinister backdrop, the movie invites the audience to engage in a spine-chilling experience, where gore is in abundance and terrifying surprises await around every corner.

Great period piece that shows how attitudes have changed in 40 years . Great production design , appealing stars , captivating performances, and an engaging plot contribute to making this period piece a true gem. Exploring themes such as societal norms, gender roles, and relationships, it reflects on the dynamic transformations in cultural values over the decades. The well-rounded characters evoke empathy and provoke discussions about progress and acceptance, while the beautiful costume design and captivating cinematography immerse viewers in the essence of the era. Overall, this film not only transports you back in time, but also sparks valuable reflections on our present-day perspective on various social aspects.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school football game. When he meets and falls for an attractive local girl she helps him realize he has a shot at a 'full ride' scholarship if he plays well.All too often, these dramas fall into formulaic traps and tell the same old story of a troubled and confused teen. FULL RIDE's Matt Sabo certainly fits this profile, but below the surface is a much more unique individual than we usually see in this genre.

then you will be a big fan of this movie. Its almost the same basic concept, a nice mixture of music, soul, and drama. I'll admit, i was a little aprehensive about seeing this movie, I had only seen previews of a white trash girl chained to a radiator, but I am a big fan of Samuel L. Jackson and I enjoyed Hustle & Flow so i thought I would give it a chance.I'm very glad that I did. It turned out to be more than just the surface story of a nymphomaniac southern girl being imprisoned by a 60 year old black man.

One of the most entertaining of all silent comedies is Pudovkin 's short 'Chess Fever ' , a mad tale of chess obsession that sweeps through an entire Russian town. Released in 1925, 'Chess Fever' masterfully intertwines the game's complexities with comic and absurd situations. As the frenzy unfolds, everyone in town, regardless of age, gender, or profession, succumbs to the unbridled passion for chess. Daily activities, romantic relationships, and even the bustling town square come to a standstill as residents are engrossed in games and strategic moves.

I shot this movie. I am very proud of the film. It was a great experience which shows up on the screen. Halfdan Hussey is an excellent collaborator who had a vision and was able to capture the movie in the exact way we envisioned while prepping the film. The sets are amazing and well crafted for each character. John York and his team built sets that not only fit the characters, they worked well in shooting the film, allowing us to move seamlessly through walls and from one set to another. Each character has an amazing arc, which makes for a great story.

Having read all of the comments on this film I am still amazed at Fox 's reluctance to release a director's cut version. Countless fans have expressed their desire to see the unedited version, but Fox seems unwilling to listen. The edited version has its fair share of memorable scenes, but undoubtedly falls short of its true potential due to these needless edits. The acting is on point, and the story intrigues, but the lack of a full and unhindered vision really keeps it from rising above the typical blockbuster flick.

This was the second Cinemascope spectacle that Fox produced after the Robe. Notice how some of the Roman sets are redressed to pass for Egyptian sets. The film is produced with all first class elements, beautiful photography, stirring soundtrack (Alfred Newman and Bernard Herrmann - see if you can tell which composer scored specific scenes). However, the principal acting is a bit weak. Edmund Purdom seems to have a limited range of emotions and is uninteresting to watch. The best performances come from Peter Ustinov as the one-eyed slave and Polish actress Bella Darvi as the Babylonian temptress "Nefer".

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are `` Blue '' . In essence, being "Blue" signifies a heightened level of consciousness and awareness during this unusual era we're living in. This encompasses having a keen understanding of not only your own emotions and thought patterns but also being receptive to the emotions and mental well-being of those around you. Furthermore, to be "Blue" means to navigate through this uncertainty with an open mind, promoting empathy, kindness, and patience while proactively addressing and working towards positive changes in society.

After seeing Meredith in "Beyond the Prairie" I had to buy another film with her staring. I cannot believe how she let herself into this teenage flick. It's best to watch this one with the sound off but just concentrate on Meredith as she moves across the screen. Save your money until the TV network comes out with a DVD on "Beyond the Prairie". It's worth it at any price, this one needs to pay you to see. This pretty lady needs someone to put her into a script that can use both her talent as an actress and her beauty as a woman.

Rabbit Seasoning is one of three cartoons that feature Bugs Bunny/Daffy Duck/Elmer Fudd in a war of words and wits about whether it's rabbit season or duck season. Love Bugs and Daffy stirring up "pronoun trouble" with Daffy always the victim of Elmer's shotgun resulting with his beak always getting dismembered. Then there's the rabbit's cross-dressing that always gets Elmer in his love struck mode. Chuck Jones and Michael Maltese are always favorites of mine in the writer-director team category because of these hilarious hunting trilogy cartoons I've laughed at since I was a kid.

I not only consider this to be the best film that Jon Voight ( Midnight Cowboy , Coming Home ) has ever been a part of, but also one of the greatest cinematic masterpieces of our time. With a compelling plot and incredibly poignant character development, this film expertly balances emotion with powerful, relatable storylines. Furthermore, Jon Voight delivers an extraordinary and unforgettable performance that speaks to his astounding range as an actor. This film, expertly crafted and unforgettably heartrending, elevates Jon Voight's illustrious career to new heights while remaining true to its grounded and humanistic roots.

I saw this movie for the first time a little over a year ago. I've seen it 4 more times since. I had never heard of it before and I consider myself knowledgeable of classic cinema. A true, polished, diamond in the rough.This gem of a movie revolves around Jon Voight (lead character "Conrack") as a young schoolteacher assigned to Yamacraw Island to teach the islands' children, all in one school. At first, the students reveal they know very little of the world beyond their island home.

Nurse Betty was definitely one of the most creative movies that's been released lately. It was funny, but it also had many touching moments. Zellwegger, Freeman, Rock, Kinnear, & the rest of the cast made their incredibly weird characters seem real. The story took such twist & turns that made it incredibly enjoyable to watch. If you're sick of the recent formula movies, see Nurse Betty for something completely different. Go see this movie in the theater or at least rent it when it comes out!

"Side Show" is one of the weirdest Horror movies ever made from Full Moon Pictures. Very gory in some places, but not as shocking as the Trailer makes it out to be (The Trailer for this movies shows all the gory parts). Also, the acting and visual effects are well done. I would recommend this movie to horror fans everywhere.8 out of 10Fans of Horror Movies like this should Check out Puppet Master, Skinned Alive, Slumber Party Massacre, Sleep Away Camp, and other Full Moon Pictures flicks.

I didn't have very high expectations about Just Before Dawn. I don't know why I keep buying these slasher movies when I know it's all the same every time. Maybe I'm a bit masochistic? Anyway, I'm glad I bought this one. Yes, it's all the same. No, it has nothing original. Yes, it's about a little group of teenagers going in the woods to camp, drink and have sex. Yes, they get killed one by one by a maniac. And you know what? It's just magic!

This Aussie flick filmed in 1999 does an OK job of portraying a bunch of small-time crooks in Kings Cross . "The Land of Dreamers" showcases the seedy underworld and grim realities faced by a ragtag crew of small-time criminals trying to navigate life in the notorious Kings Cross neighborhood. With their quirks, dubious morals, and dead-end aspirations, these characters provide a raw depiction of the fringe members of society in late 90s Australia. The gritty cinematography, authentic dialogues, and complex characters manage to captivate audiences as the gang tries to hustle their way up in the unforgiving world they inhabit.

It may have been inevitable that with the onslaught of `` slasher '' movies in the early 1980 's , some Hollywood directors and producers would decide to deviate from the standard horror formula and opt for a more campy and humorous approach. This was perfectly epitomized with the advent of the "horror-comedy" sub-genre, providing a unique blend of dark humor and satirical commentary that emerged during that time period. One of the most successful and enduring examples of the horror-comedy genre was 1984's 'Gremlins', directed by Joe Dante, which ingeniously married together dark horror themes and outlandish creature features with clever satirical gags and relatable situational humor.

I saw this fine flick shortly leaving college . As I sat there happily watching Alice go from repressed virgin to a strong and empowered woman, I was filled with a sense of excitement and liberation. This compelling tale brilliantly captures the essence of finding oneself and one's sexual identity amidst the chaos of the late '60s counterculture. With bold colors, evocative imagery, and breathtaking performances, the film transports the audience to a world where barriers were being broken, and freedoms explored. My heart raced alongside Alice's journey as she sought pleasure, discovery, and personal growth against a vibrant, evocative backdrop of defiance and individualism.

If you overlook the fact that the plot has been done many times , this is a hilarious and gleefully irreverent take on the classic narrative. The film delights in its self-awareness and sharply penned dialogue, constantly poking fun at both the genre and the audience's expectations. The characters are well-drawn, even while lampooning familiar stereotypes, and the on-screen chemistry between the leads drives much of the comedy. Some might argue that originality is key, but the inventive and riotous spin that the movie puts on its tropes ensures its fresh, delightful appeal.

One of the many backwoods horror 's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. "Deepwoods Massacre" (1983) manages to capture the haunting, creepy atmosphere and dread of those times quite well, standing alongside cult classics like "Friday the 13th" and "The Texas Chainsaw Massacre". It revolves around a group of teenagers venturing into a remote, wooded area only to be confronted with an unspeakable terror lurking in the shadows. Unlike its contemporaries, the film emphasizes more on the eerie setting and psychological tension rather than relying solely on gore and graphic violence.

My kids loved this movie . we watched it every chance we got.it was fun a fun movie . we couldn't get enough of the catchy songs and engaging storyline. The characters were both hilarious and relatable, making it enjoyable for both children and adults. The vibrant animation and the voice cast were impressive and added extra magic to the film. We found ourselves singing and dancing along to the tunes, even after the movie had ended. Not only was it entertaining, but the movie also imparted some valuable lessons on friendship, love, and teamwork.

I have been watching King of Queens from the beginning , and have felt it is overlooked at the award ceremonies. The series showcases incredible chemistry between the lead actors, Kevin James and Leah Remini, that successfully propels the humorous aspects of everyday life. Their authentic portrayal of a quirky couple deeply resonates with the audience. Alongside them, Jerry Stiller's comedic talent as Arthur Spooner remains truly noteworthy. Despite its humble presentation and familiar tropes, King of Queens consistently entertains and finds laughter in genuine connections. I believe the series genuinely deserved greater recognition and accolades for its nine-year run that made it a fan-favorite comedy.

Unlike some of the former commentators , I was ( and am ) an avid fan of the Carpenters . I found their music to be an exemplary fusion of soulful vocals and melodious tunes that encapsulates the essence of the 1970s musical era. Karen Carpenter's velvet voice effortlessly conveyed emotions in every track, touching the hearts of listeners. Richard's flair for songwriting and orchestration gave each piece depth and charm, and together, their talent translated into an impressive discography. They created evergreen classics, helping many build connections with nostalgia and often working as solace in times of stress.

I saw this movie with my girlfriends and we all loved it ! It is so sweet and heartwarming , the perfect feel-good film to watch with friends. The storyline captured our attention right from the start and held us emotionally engaged till the end. The characters were well-developed, relatable, and truly brought the plot to life. The beautiful visuals and soothing music perfectly complemented the onscreen drama, evoking strong emotions within us. Overall, we laughed, cried, and felt every emotion throughout the film, leaving us feeling fulfilled and thoroughly entertained.

I have been a `` huge '' rush fan ever since `` moving pictures '' and this concert is simply amazing! From the jaw-dropping visuals to the impeccable musicianship, Rush once again exceeded all of my expectations. This band just continues to showcase their incredible talent and ageless energy, which make them so legendary. The setlist at this concert perfectly combines classics like "Tom Sawyer" and "Limelight" with some lesser-known gems, ensuring every fan has a song to cherish. Rush's performance is engaging, emotional, and technically precise.

People need to give this show a chance. The people who write bad reviews (there are very few of them) are clearly people who haven't seen many episodes. One needs to really sit down and pay attention to this show to appreciate it. All of the characters are realistic because they have so many flaws. They make mistakes, but they are REALISTIC mistakes, which is an uncommon thing to see on television today. Also, for the most part the acting is superb. Lauren Graham has been snubbed of an Emmy for six years now.

The whole shorthand for supposedly being more aware in this weird time is that you are "Blue". The Blue State mentality. This is supposed to get us off the hook for what is/was happening during the last few years in our country (The USA). It doesn't get anyone off the hook but it makes us feel better, as though we aren't benefiting in any way from living here and getting all the good stuff that a US citizen gets just by being a US citizen. But I'm so sick of bitching about this. It doesn't do any good.

My girlfriend and I saw this movie when it was originally released. The controversy that surrounded the original release (teen nudity, physical intimacy and unwed pregnancy) were subjects that never touched our view of the film. We were close to the same age as Paul and Michelle and were experiencing many of the same intense and confusing emotions. We were too young to get caught up in the simplistic (at times) acting and the corny (at times) emotional twists. This movie spoke to us in a way that an adult love story never could have.

I 've been waiting almost 25 years to see this hard to find horror thriller and I finally did since it was recently uploaded to a streaming platform. It absolutely lived up to my expectations! The film was everything I hoped it would be: eerie, suspenseful, and the right amount of campy. The old-school special effects blended well with the overall atmosphere, successfully creating the terrifying, edge-of-your-seat vibe. Despite the movie being relatively underrated in the realm of classic horror thrillers, it‚Äôs genuinely a hidden gem worth every second spent finding it.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for "Once Upon A Time in the West" but couldn't persuade Clint Eastwood to appear in. Three tough-looking gunfighters ride into a town. One is dressed like the Man with No Name in a poncho. Another is dressed like Colonel Mortimer from "For A Few Dollars More," and the third is garbed like Django, except he rides a horse instead of pulls a coffin behind him with a machine gun in it. Our hero meets them in Main Street behind a wagon loaded with three coffins.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film. To have it totally wash over you, so that you absorb it as it is, and thus, experience it to the fullest. Every time I see it, 'The Egyptian' is such a film. Over the years it is a picture critics have loved to hate. Many have thrown darts at its vulnerabilities. But perhaps it is because of the very tone the film brings with it rather than its most obvious characteristics. It is at once forbidding, remote, possibly dangerous; beware of what lies within!

Come on . Anyone who does n't understand the greatness of this here cartoon should be kicked off any critic 's platform. I mean, this isn't just a simple animated show ‚Äì it's a groundbreaking, layered masterpiece that weaves humor, emotion, and intellectual brilliance into every single frame. From the stellar voice cast to the brilliant animation, every aspect of this cartoon deserves recognition and appreciation. Anyone who claims otherwise is simply turning a blind eye to artistic ingenuity. Furthermore, the cultural impact and relatability of this masterpiece allows viewers of all ages to connect on a profound level.

The film begins with a cranky old Broadway producer ( exceptionally well-played by veteran character actor Richard Carle ) being forced into retirement by his board of directors. Feeling defeated, he plots revenge by creating a new musical production designed to be a massive failure. His assistant, played charmingly by Judith Thayle, discovers the plan but, seeing his determination, secretly recruits a talented young cast and production team to save the show. With delightful music, well-executed dance numbers, and numerous plot twists, the stage is set for an entertaining journey that follows a heartfelt story of redemption and friendship, proving that the show truly must go on.

Strange enough , shorts like this get a 10 . Why ? They are hilarious . This is hilarious . I must admit that I was skeptical at first, but as I watched it unfold, I found myself laughing uncontrollably. The humor was just so unexpected, quirky, and refreshingly different from the usual comedy that one may find. It left me wanting more! In today's fast-paced world, having a quick burst of comedy that is effective in tickling our funny bones is what makes shorts like these stand out from the rest.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if they click with each other. Matt is pretty unlikeable: aloof, braggart, seemingly lazy, and a misogynist. He's been hurt badly by his dysfunctional mom and this makes him a little easier to take. I guess I liked the details of his dysfunction--he was believable. He overcompensates by bragging that he'l nail Amy. He acts so cool around Amy that he strikes out twice. When they do talk he can't show her who he really is.

After I've seen this movie I find it hard to understand why so many people seem to hate this movie. I'm not saying it belongs in the top 250 of all times, but in it's genre it is a great movie. I know, not many people find it amusing to see how a legendary story like 'Robin Hood' is turned into a comedy. Many people still seem to believe that some things shouldn't be laughed with ... they are wrong. Mel Brooks has done an excellent job with Robin Hood: Men in Tights.

Wagon Master (1950) Dir: John Ford Production: Argosy Pictures / RKO Radio Pictures John Ford brings the stock company out into the Utah desert to film a western and comes out with this minor classic. No John Wayne, no conflicted anti-heroes, no psychological exploration, no fireworks, just a gem of a picture.This ensemble piece nominally stars Ben Johnson (as Travis) and Harry Carey Jr. (Sandy). They're horse traders who come into town to do some business just as a group of Mormons, led by Ward Bond, are being shown the exit.

Okay I marked this spoiler so don't be upset when I wrap this up. Now I went into the movie expecting to see a very predictable movie. And I was right, as almost every horror flick I have ever seen it was predictable but not as bad as most. What helped was the story, I did not expect there to be a "WHY" to Kane's madness. But there was and while somewhat foggy you still got the idea and understand the madness. Now of course if you like something that will scare you for nights to come this is not the movie your looking for.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in Bogot√°, you can feel the total meaning of the word "Bluff"(although is a Colombian film, the title is in presented in English); ! The story is about Nicolas Andrade (Federico Lorusso), a photographer who find his girlfriend Margarita (Catalina Aristizabal) having an affair with his boss Pablo Mallarino (Victor Mallarino), owner of a magazine; after this Nicolas is left without girlfriend and without any job.

There are many film now on DVD, but producers had forgotten some tittles of importance to many moviegoers. The Egyptian, along with El Cid and other favorites of the era of the wide screen, big budget epics had merit. Many people from my generation learn a lot about history of Egypt, medieval Spain and even the Incas, (The first time I heard from them was a very cheap adventure movie with Charlton Heston called The Treasure of the Incas), same happened to me with Egypt, or Rome seen many "bad" epics of the era.

Having just got the "Loony Tunes Golden Collection"(which i HIGHLY recommend, by the way), I'm going to try to comment on most if not all of the cartoons individually. As such the starting statement might seem redundant for those whom read multiple reviews of them, for this i apologize.Rabbit Seasoning is the middle short in a trilogy of like-minded shorts (the other two being "Rabbit Fire" and "Duck! Rabbit, Duck). Bags and Daffy argue about who Elmer Fudd should short. It makes me laugh EVERY SINGLE TIME!!!

Susie Q. is one of those rare , and sweet movies that give you a warm feeling . It 's a heartwarming tale of friendship, love, and second chances that keeps you captivated throughout. The film revolves around a teenager named Zach, who encounters the ghost of Susie Q., a young girl who tragically died in the 1950s. Through their unlikely bond, both characters are able to rediscover the beauty in life and learn the power of forgiveness. Packed with endearing characters and moments, Susie Q. has a timeless charm that reminds us of the importance of cherishing our relationships and understanding each other's struggles.

Both Jackie and Candice are terrific in this movie. They are well-suited to their roles and have several chances to shine. In particular, the way Candice pronounces the words "Puerto Rican" is very funny, as she is being kind as she can be but condescending at the same time. I had seen the original of this movie, called "Old Acquaintance", starring Bette Davis and Miriam Hopkins. They allegedly did not get along, so because the movie is about female friendship, that might have been a problem. Here, the actresses clearly admire and respect each other.

I got to watch this movie in my french class as part of lets say `` french culture '' . I found it to be a truly enlightening experience, delving deeper into the various aspects of French culture and society. The movie beautifully captured the nuances of everyday life in France, and also the traditions that make it so unique. Through the characters, dialogues, and scenes, I could clearly sense the essence of their history and way of living. As I discussed the movie with my classmates and analyzed its message, I realized the richness and diversity of the French culture.

Awww , I love this ! The Tale of the Cat and the Moon does n't really need an synopsis because the title itself speaks for its beauty and essence. Delving deeper into this charming fable, it captivates readers with its evocative portrayal of the timeless bond between the alluring cat and the mystical moon. Gorgeously interweaving love and yearning, the enchanting characters are whisked through adventures filled with starlit encounters and playful rendezvous, each nocturnal meeting deepening the inexplicable connection they share. Tender and evocative, the Tale of the Cat and the Moon teaches us the power of dreams, resilience, and the depths of the heart's desire.

I was mighty impressed with Nurse Betty all the way through . It has a great ensemble of characters , each one quirky and unique, creating a delightful tapestry of personalities. The dark humor interwoven throughout the story makes even the tensest moments enjoyable, while the emotional beats offer moments of sincere connection between the characters. Nurse Betty showcases brilliantly balanced pacing, ensuring viewers are entertained while fully understanding the intricate relationships at play. Add in exceptional cinematography and you have yourself a truly unforgettable movie-watching experience that's destined to leave its mark in the annals of film history.

I'm not the biggest fan of westerns. My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven, and Tombstone. This movie though, I loved! It was great! The plot was well done, and it was a fun movie. Everybody who had a part in this movie did excellent! I even think it beat out both movies in someway. Well, not really Unforgiven because that was a superb movie that these two can't compare with in the long run. I do think it beat out Tombstone though. Both had its strong points.

Just Before Dawn is one of those really good slashers that send chills down your spine every time you watch it! This movie has great suspense, great acting, very well done camera work (nice job Mr. Lieberman!) which makes a extremely well made slasher! Though low on gore for the 80s, it still has the effect on you after it is over. The opening kill (machete through the crotch) looked so real! And the fist to the mouth death left me stunned! Overall i give this lost classic 10 stars out of 10 stars!

One of the better made for TV biopics, I just wish it had told us more. I have read many biographies and seen other things about the Carpenters, and this movie did what it could, based on the constraints placed on it by the family. Cynthis Gibb did a wonderful job trying to bring Karen to life. One of my disappointments is that there was not more insight into Karen's anorexia. In the reading I have done about the disease (especially Cherry Boone O'Neill's wonderful book, Starving for Attention) anorexia appears to be a disease of control.

If you are a fan of early Duke movies, this Lone Star oldie is a good one. What more could you ask for than Duke, Yak, and Gabby. Lots of good ridin' and shootin'!!! I found it amazing that Duke's singing voice was Bill Bradbury, who is none other than Bob Steele's twin brother. It has been reported that Bob Steele was a high school classmate and friend of Duke, so twin brother Bill may have been too. Anyway, if you like good, clean, early western movies don't miss this one.

Minor spoilers follow , but nothing you wo n't have learned from reading the back of the DVD.Held together by a strong and intricate narrative, the story unfolds with surprising twists and revelations that keep you glued to your screen. The diverse cast delivers a riveting and emotional performance that pulls you into each character's unique struggles and hidden motives. Visually stunning with well-crafted cinematography and a masterful score, the film beautifully intertwines the powerful themes of family, friendship, and sacrifice. The DVD boasts special features including a behind-the-scenes look into the making of this remarkable work of art, enhancing the entire experience of watching this modern classic.

A train holding union soldiers is transporting $300,000 of gold, along with a banker Clayton, who's there to see it reaches its destination, but it's suddenly robbed by the bandit Monetero. However Bahunda nicks off with the gold and hides it, but when Monetero tries to get it out of him, he's killed by soldiers. The only clue is that of a medallion, but Monetero is captured and soon would be executed. A stranger dressed up as a priest comes by (who after the bounty of Monetero) and offers to save his life for half of the gold.

This is one of those movies that was never publicized and therefore was missed when it originally played in the theaters. However, its brilliance was eventually discovered by critics and indie-film lovers, transforming it into a hidden gem in the realm of cinema. The storyline captivated viewers with its heartfelt message and uniquely portrayed characters. Fueled by their passion for genuine storytelling, the cast delivered outstanding performances, accompanied by a subtle but moving soundtrack. The film's lingering impact sparked important conversations, and served as a prime example of why great art deserves an audience beyond its box office results.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking . I 'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged in equal measure. The performances were captivating, the storyline complex, yet easy to follow, and the cinematography truly awe-inspiring. While exploring relevant and important social themes, the director still manages to inject humor, making it a captivating watch for audiences of all ages. Despite its intense moments, the film remains an overall feel-good experience, allowing viewers to leave the cinema both reflecting and smiling. Don't miss this stunning cinematic gem ‚Äì a must-see that promises to linger in your thoughts long after the credits roll.

When I saw the preview for this movie , I figured to myself , `` here 's another dumb TV show adaptation that's going to flop miserably. '' But boy, was I wrong. From the moment the opening credits rolled, I was pulled into the storyline and couldn't peel my eyes away. The cinematography was stunning and the acting - incredibly on point. In fact, the characters were so engaging, that it barely felt like an adaptation; more of a reinvention, with the essence of the original, sprinkled with a modern twist.

You will be able to tell within the first 30 seconds of this film whether you want to finish watching it. The film opens with images of planes landing at an airport, one plane after another diving into a mirage-filled runway. You will be able to accurately guess that this movie is not about a "story." At first viewing, it's even easy to think the opening images are repetitive shots of the same plane. The initial drama is in the acuteness of your perception, which is built on your willingness to experience the film simply as a series of images.

Watching The Wagonmaster is not likely to result in deep thoughts, unlike many other great Ford films, like The Searchers, My Darling Clementine, The Man Who Shot Liberty Valance, and The Grapes of Wrath among others, but it is likely to produce a feeling of awe and deep satisfaction. The story is very simple: two cowboys decide to help a wagon train of Mormons get to California. Along the way, they run into a medicine man whose mules ran away, a group of bank robbers, and some Navajos.

First love. Teenage love. We all have experienced it even if it was not as sweet as the one the protagonists share. "Friends" could be considered an adaptation of the classic "The Blue Lagoon", originally from 1949, and its remakes from 1980 (the most popular one, with Brooke Shields) and 1999 (with a young Milla Jovovich). While "The Blue Lagoon" puts the two young lovers in a desert island, with no contact with civilization, "Friends" goes the opposite route and it is sure to ring much more true and be a more difficult movie with contemporary audiences.

It 's hard to know what to make of this weird little Aussie crime flick - on the one hand , it has some genuinely engaging moments of dark humor and clever plot twists, showcasing the uniqueness of Australian storytelling. On the other hand, it struggles to maintain a cohesive tone and falters under the weight of convoluted plotlines, wavering between bizarre, comedic incidents and intensely gritty, uncomfortable moments. The film has a strong local flavor, with its outback settings, colorful characters, and impenetrable accents - making it alluring to both local and foreign audiences.

Gilmore Girls is one of the funniest , most clever , sharp-witted , sarcastic and heart-warming television shows I 've ever watched. The show revolves around the lovable relationship between a young single mother, Lorelai Gilmore, and her fiercely intelligent daughter, Rory. Set in the charming town of Stars Hollow, the duo navigate their way through love, friendship, and various odd town traditions. Accompanied by a rich supporting cast of eccentric characters, Gilmore Girls delivers witty dialogues and memorable pop-culture references at a break-neck speed, ensuring there's never a dull moment.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film's lead actor Fabian Stratas' deliberate mispronunciation of Falkland, a reference to the film's setting and a rather less than subtle allusion to the secret agenda of its protagonist.Fabian is an Argentine national, an amateur magician passing himself off as a tourist visiting the Falklands soon after it is reopened to its people. His master plan is to win the ultimate struggle by seducing and impregnating the local females, commencing with the delicious Camilla,thus siring an entire generation of half Argentinians.

Great Movie ! The sound track is awesome ! Very relaxing sound . Elton was ahead of his own time ! This film truly captures the essence of Elton's extraordinary musical genius. Not only were the sound and audio quality top-notch, but the masterful use of his soothing and captivating melodies leaves the viewers feeling as if they were enveloped in a warm embrace. Moreover, the cinematography and the visuals in the movie further elevate its brilliance, portraying Elton's journey and talent beautifully on screen. The film perfectly marries its visual and audio elements to provide an unforgettable, immersive experience for the audience.

I just started watching The Show around July. I found it by mistake, I was channel surfing during a Vacation. It is a great show, I just wish it wasn't on so late at night. It's on at 12:30 AM. As a working person it makes it hard to watch all the time.I read some comments. I did not agree with the late one about not growing up in the 60's and not believing that this stuff can happen.I grew up in the 60's. I'm Hispanic and I had a "White" boyfriend plus we had black friends in High School.

I saw this film on TV in the UK some 25 years ago and it has resonated with me ever since. My interest has recently been rekindled by visiting Hilton Head - the next island over from "Yamacraw" (Daufuskie actually), and reading Pat Conroy's excellent "The Water is Wide". With the benefit of knowledge I have reappraised Conrack and consider it a masterpiece. Jon Voight captures the spirit of Conroy and the atmosphere of the film brings the book to life with some accuracy - a Hollywood rarity. Three things still strike me about this tale: 1.

I saw the movie in 1972 , and like other people who have commented on it here ... I went to the theater with high expectations. As the lights dimmed and the film began, it quickly became clear that it would leave a lasting impression on me. With its captivating storyline, memorable characters, and remarkable performances by the talented cast, this movie not only met my expectations but far exceeded them. In retrospect, it was an innovative and groundbreaking cinematic masterpiece for that time, with lasting cultural relevance even today. Every scene of the film held my interest and transported me to the intriguing world the director had crafted.

One of the many backwoods horror's that came out in the early eightes and fortunately this is one of the better ones. Yes it has a cheesy plot but I was pleasantly surprised at this film, because I thought it was really good and really entertaining, although the killer could have been made a bit more scarier he just looked like a fat slob.First of all, we have the local sheriff or whatever the hell he is, who warns them not to go to those mountains as they are very dangerous. But when the teens arrive, it doesn't seem very dangerous at all, well according to me anyway.

One of the most pleasurable aspects of movie viewing is to get lost in a film . To have it transport you to another world and leave your own life behind for a brief moment, immersing yourself in the characters' experiences and the unfolding storyline. This magical experience is enhanced when the cinematography is beautifully crafted, accompanied by powerful and moving performances from the actors. There's a real sense of emotional escapism in movie viewing, as well as the opportunity to gain fresh insights and perspectives, learning from the journeys and growth of those characters that manage to resonate with us in meaningful and profound ways.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool . I finally had the chance to watch it the other day and I must say, it definitely lived up to my expectations. The visuals were stunning and the plot was full of thrilling twists and turns that kept me engaged throughout. The performances from the main actors were brilliant, delivering just the right blend of emotion and action. I was impressed by the balance between special effects and storytelling which, together, kept the adrenaline pumping from beginning to end.

I saw this movie back in 1954 on a double-bill with "Valley of the Kings." These movies helped inspire a lifelong interest in Egyptology. (In 1975 I visited Egypt!) Seen today, "The Egyptian" suffers from flat dialog and a few gauche touches, but it's a glorious movie to look at -- the sort of thing Hollywood, alas, just doesn't do anymore -- and it has a great story... not just the usual boy-meets-girl or vengeance-is-mine affair. Too bad 20th won't re-issue restored prints of this to be seen on the Big Screen.

During the War for Southern Independence, GENERAL SPANKY mobilizes his forces to defend the local women & children against a Yankee invasion.In 1936, Hal Roach decided it was time for his popular OUR GANG kids to branch out into occasional feature-length films. With the big success of Shirley Temple in two Civil War period movies in 1935 (THE LITTLE COLONEL, THE LITTLEST REBEL), it was only natural that Roach would look in that same direction for his GANG. Although given a rather lavish production and distributed by MGM, GENERAL SPANKY was not a critical or box-office success.

In the midst of a documentary about his parents, the filmmaker's mother dies, but he continues making the documentary, discovering a story he did not anticipate. The result is an absorbing drama that has the quality of fiction in the best sense of that word, where a likable but unknowing narrator unwittingly privileges the audience. The narrative thus has a double weave, the story of the documentary and the story of the documentary-maker.Our admiration is with the filmmaker, not only for doggedly pursuing his story though it risks his entire notion of his parents' relationship, but also for never giving in to sensationalism or melodrama.

it's the best movie i have ever seen!!!!!! i just love them!! i watch it every day! i have the episodes from the internet! here in Romania is being broadcast the 6 season! i'm happy that i have seen the show from the beginning and i'm glad that through the internet i can see the 7 season. until now, season 5 is my favorite one :D i love it because Logan appears and the scene where they jump is my favorite. i have liked Dean too, but Logan is best.

These cartoon writers are unrelenting with their corny ( and fun ) puns . The first shot we see in the episode is of a quirky little store called "What's in a Grain," a clever play on Shakespeare's line "What's in a name," showcasing that not even grocery shops can escape their humor. This trend only grows more comical as we get a glimpse of some animal-based parodies like "Jurassic Pork," "Raging Bull Frog," and the ice cream joint "Sundae Gogh," a cute nod to Vincent Van Gogh.

A talented high school graduating senior with a bad attitude is forced to play in the state all-star high school basketball game as part of a probation requirement for a minor offense. At first, the troubled senior clashes with the diverse teammates and strict coaches, dismissing their passion and dedication to the sport. Over time, as the team members relentlessly work to break down his walls, he slowly learns the values of humility, cooperation, and teamwork. This challenging journey helps transform him, leading to a heartfelt moment of redemption during the nail-biting final game, where he truly becomes a vital part of the all-star team.

It's interesting to watch how late 1950's society is depicted in this film. Men are lecherous, chain-smoking boozers with one thing on their minds (time hasn't changed men all that much, but "sexual harassment" has) & women are in the workplace only passing time until they find a husband & settle down. Some of the dialog is cringe-worthy but yet it's charming in an innocent, pass√© way. I love the opening credits that show a romantic, exciting view of Manhattan with Johnny Mathis singing "The Best Of Everything" on the soundtrack.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V . and came across a fascinating documentary about deep-sea creatures. The vivid imagery and mesmerizing facts about their mysterious world captivated me, making me lose track of time. Suddenly, I realized I was running late for work, and I rushed to grab my things, turning off the T.V. on my way out. Throughout the day, my mind kept drifting back to those underwater wonders. My fascination with their bizarre appearances and adaptive abilities ignited a new interest and determination to learn more about our ocean's hidden treasures.

This movie has a lot to recommend it . The paintings , the music , and David Hewlett 's naked butt are all delightful aspects that you won't want to miss. Not to mention the captivating plot that keeps you on the edge of your seat, wondering what twist or turn may come next. Additionally, the all-star cast delivers phenomenal performances, bringing their characters to life and further immersing the audience into the world of the film. The exquisite cinematography adds another layer to this movie-going experience, making this visually stunning work an absolute treat for the eyes.

I just want to say that Chris Diamantopoulos's role as Williams for that entire show, was Emmy worthy. It was uncanny how well he did. And to be as rapid-fire and as random and as creative as Robin Williams really is....WOW. There were scenes where Diamantopoulos had to say probably 20 rapid fire lines and do 15 different characters while delivering those lines, all while sounds as much like ROBIN WILLIAMS doing those characters.....well, that my friends is impressive acting. Its one thing to do a Robin Williams impersonation for a couple of minutes.

Flawless writing and brilliant acting make this unusually delightful and witty plot-twister one of the best American films I have seen this year. Neil Labute's terrific casting and cynical direction keeps this film from becoming too sentimental while Ren√©e Zellweger and Morgan Freeman's authentic performances give it a soul. Violent, provocative and humorous at the same time with a truly wonderful ending. Chris Rock, Greg Kinnear Aaron Eckhart, Crispin Glover and Allison Janney all give uproarious, tongue in cheek performances. The greatest spoof of soap operas since the movie Soap, but better and smarter. 9 out of 10.

Pity the poor reviewer who disliked / did n't understand this wonderful film . What a sad life he must lead, unable to appreciate and comprehend the intricacies and nuances of this cinematic masterpiece. It is, of course, not every moviegoer's cup of tea, and subjective opinions may vary, but dismissing it outright showcases a profound ignorance and a clear disconnection from the art of filmmaking. It begs the question - what joy and satisfaction does the critic draw from movies? To immerse oneself in such brilliance and not be captivated can only make one ponder what exceptional universe of artistic fulfillment they inhabit, seemingly untouched by human hand.

A rather charming depiction of European union beginning to operate among the young generation as representatives of that group learn to embrace diversity and engage in collaborative efforts across borders. This emerging dynamic within the youth is empowering and encourages them to recognize their collective potential, celebrate cultural richness and forge stronger bonds between the different countries. As these youths rise into leadership positions, this new wave of cooperation in the EU could translate into improved economic policies, educational systems, and technological advancements benefiting all member countries. Thus, planting the seeds for an interconnected European Union that takes strength from unity while proudly sustaining cultural diversity.

I guess my husband and I are a little slow . We do n't usually warm up to a series until it's well underway, maybe even near the end of its run. Case in point, we only recently discovered the brilliance of "Breaking Bad," though the series concluded almost a decade ago. Binge-watching it now, we wonder how we could have missed such incredible storytelling and phenomenal acting. It seems this slow approach allows us to experience hidden gems on our own terms, even though it might put us behind in popular culture conversations.

As Betty Sizemore ( Renee Zellweger ) secretly watches her tyrannical husband Del ( Aaron Eckhart ) being murdered by two violent thugs, her life turns into a mixture of fear, sadness, and twisted fantasy. Emotionally shaken, she loses her grip on reality and begins to fully immerse herself in her favorite soap opera, "A Reason to Love." Soon enough, her mental and emotional distress compels her to embark on a quest to track down her favorite actor, Dr. David Ravell ( Greg Kinnear ), in order to seek salvation, solace, and love.

This is the story of a guy who went up to see a comedy and it turned out to be the best night of his life. Arriving at the quaint comedy club, the anticipation in the air was palpable. As the acts progressed, each performer had him bursting with laughter, a much-needed release after his monotonous routine. The laughter therapy continued and as if the fates conspired to uplift his spirits further, a connection sparked with the woman seated beside him. Together they laughed and cheered, sharing snippets of their lives.

"Americans Next Top Model" is the best reality show! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time watching it.I kept my eyes open the entire time. (well, I did blink) It can be sad, funny, or addicting. (mostly addicting)"America's Next Top Model" kept me wanting more and that's pretty much the point. It is also on more that one channel. Sometimes it's on MTV other times it's not. I hope it gets more fans and grows to be a hit series!

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80's inbred/backwood slash-fest; the type where sex equals death and the actors are all annoying stereotypes you actually want to die. However, "JBD" delivers considerably more.Rather than focus on bare flesh and gore (though there is a little of each- no sex however), the flick focuses on delivering impending dread/mounting tension amidst a lovely scenic backdrop. These feelings are further heightened by a cast of realistically likable characters and antagonists that are more amoral than cardboard definitions of evil.

Almost 20 years before Frank Marshall brought tears to your eyes with his mesmerizing epic "Alive", there already was the legendary Mexican exploitation director Ren√© Cardona who used the same drama as an outline for his ambitious film "Supervivientes de los Andes". The unforgettable fatal flight of Fairchild 571 that crashed in the Argentinian Andes on October 13, 1972. This terrible accident cost the lives of many passengers, most of them members of a professional rugby team. But 16 people of them were eventually rescued thanks to their strong will to survive and because they fed on the mortal remains of their unfortunate fellow-passengers.

This movie was awesome, if you want a movie with non-stop puns and laughter then this is right for you. This movie was great because it took the serious Robin Hood and made it something the whole family can enjoy and get a good laugh at. I first viewed this movie when i was around 10, and got most of it. This movie is also great because it makes fun of everything involved, "By order of the kings financial secretary H and R Blockhead? "Everyone needs a little Cary Elwes(Robin Hood)in life, whether or not its Liar Liar with the "Claw" or Saw.

THE CELL (2000) Rating: 8/10The Cell, like Antz, must be watched twice to be appreciated. The first time I saw this film I thought it was mediocre, but the film had such a lasting impression on me after viewing, I decided I had to rent it again. I did, and I found the film to be much more likeable. The Cell is not for everyone, but it divides its stories up with quality and is a visually intelligent film that dreams up images and plot ideas that could not be matched.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old , ( having an existing interest in cinema even at that young age). It was a transformative experience that further fueled my passion for movies. The film captured my imagination with its spellbinding storyline, engaging characters, and mesmerizing visuals, leaving a lasting impact on me. Years later, I find myself frequently revisiting this cinematic masterpiece and marveling at its timeless brilliance. Through it, I learned the power of storytelling, sparking my own desire to be a part of the creative world.

Hmm, is it right to compare Tiffani Thiessen and Mark-Paul Gosselaar's post Saved By The Bell acting? Of course it's not right, it's ridiculous. And is right to give this movie a `10' rating? Hahahahahaha... that's funny. This movie wasn't so horrible, though; better than I expected it to be. Made-for-TV movies are often so so so similar. So many of them have the same feel to them. This one had that same feel but it worked even though it was yet another tortured wife who's gotta get the b*stard in the end story.

I was on my way out one morning when I was checking something on the T.V. and came across this film. I don't ever remember seeing this or hearing of it. What a fun and interesting one to watch. Well, my meeting was pushed back, because I couldn't get out of this film. It had some real interesting things in it that marked it's time in history, and some fun things that they don't have people do in today's film because it's not pretty. Well, there was a lot of realism in it.

Others have commented on the somewhat strange video arrangements . I think they were trying to capture what you 'd expect from a futuristic sci-fi movie scene. The unconventional camera angles and obscure visual effects seem to be deliberately crafted to make you feel like you're in an otherworldly space. Personally, I appreciate this sort of creative take on visual storytelling, as it adds a unique atmosphere and immersion that distinguishes it from traditional approaches. Despite some of the confusing imagery, the central message of the video does shine through and proves to be quite thought-provoking, sparking discussions about our future society and potential advancements in technology.

I can't comment on the accuracy of this production, historical or literary, but I can say that I enjoyed it. If there is a God, the sound track will be released, Ilona Sekacz' work is truly enduring. Twenty years on I am still moved by the haunting themes of this production and return to it frequently.The story surrounds the entry into society of Catherine Moreland. Somewhat awkward and possessed of an unhealthy interest in Gothic stories (early pulp fiction? ), Catherine descends on Bath in the company of Mrs Allen where she meets Henry Tilney.

...I saw this movie when it first came out in France, in my hometown, 54 years ago, I was nine, and today I still remember each black and white frame, especially the black ones, because it was so tense, scary, those sneaking attacks through that dark pass in the mountain, the two soldiers, prisoners forced to fight each other by their captors, the last battle with the uncovering of the wagon with the Gatling in it firing away, the last fight between Peck and the chief, and the Happy End which let me take back my breath.

Onstage John Osborne 's adaptation of `` Picture of Dorian Gray '' is a fine tribute to Oscar Wilde 's novel. This theatrical rendition masterfully captures the essence of Wilde's story, exploring the themes of vanity, moral corruption, and hedonism. The cast is exceptional, as they effectively portray the intricacies and dilemmas faced by their characters, giving them an authentic depth that maintains audience interest. The set design and lighting serve to enhance the dark, sinister tone of the play, taking audiences through a Victorian-era London setting that mirrors Dorian's moral descent.

Just watched Conrack for the first time . Although the last third of the movie leaves something to be desired , overall it was an enjoyable experience. The plot revolves around a young and passionate teacher, Pat Conroy, who aims to break the barriers of race and ignorance in a remote island's segregated school. While the beginning and middle of the movie managed to grip me with engaging storytelling and heartfelt performances from Jon Voight and the young cast, it somewhat failed to tie up loose ends and effectively deliver an emotional conclusion.

Whoever cast this movie was a genius , every character in it is perfect for their part , and they all bring a unique element to the story that captivates the audience from start to finish. The exceptional ensemble not only showcases remarkable acting talent, but they also share great chemistry, ensuring that each scene comes to life on the screen. Moreover, the flawless blending of well-known actors with up-and-coming talents has further enriched the film, making it feel fresh and engaging. This brilliant casting decision truly enhances the movie-going experience, inviting viewers into a captivating and believable world filled with memorable performances.

This show is my guilty pleasure all the way!! When I first tuned in to America's Next Top Model, I expected to be bored, and to find it very very stupid. I didn't. This show is actually serious fun. I read on one of the other reviews that it makes you wonder if you have what it takes to be America's Next top model. And it so does! Who doesn't love the glamour and excitement that come with being a model? On ANTM you get to see what it's REALLY like.

This film was both entertaining and thought-provoking. I'd recommend it to everyone who wants to be moved and challenged. Great acting, directing - and it is Canadian to boot! It is a film that families can enjoy and serious movie lovers. The locations in Ontario evoked such a sense of nostalgia for the era. With so much garbage and superficial hype selling these days it is great to see that someone could back an independent flick. For any family that has risen to overcome a challenge or an obstacle - be it financial or illness - this film strikes a resounding chord!

it 's the best movie i have ever seen ! ! ! ! ! ! i just love them ! The acting was phenomenal, the plot had numerous twists and turns that kept me engaged from start to finish, and the cinematography was nothing short of breathtaking. Each character had depth and development throughout the film that had me emotionally invested in their stories. The soundtrack perfectly set the tone for each scene and pulled me even deeper into the world created by the director. This is one movie I can watch over and over again, never tiring of its captivating scenes and memorable dialogue.

I was drawn to "Friends" by the soundtrack scored by a very young and yet to be famous Elton John whom I had see in a club in nearby Houston. I had no idea of the emotions and impact the movie would make. Recently I was brought back to the movie by a song that Heart did called "Seasons", then I found the Elton John song "Friends" thinking it was the same song...it's been 35 years of so. Anyway, the flood of the emotions of "Friends" came back like seeing an old photograph of your first real love.

Gilmore Girls is a hilarious show with never ending sarcasm, wit, and charm. At age 16 Lorelai Gilmore gave birth to Rory Gilmore. She left her parents house and got a job. Now, Lorelai and Rory have a relationship that many mothers and daughters envy. They are best friends. The girls have an extensive knowledge of movies, and TV shows, and are constantly quoting them. In the first season, Lorelai needs money to send Rory to Chilton ( a very highly rated high school), so she reluctantly has to turn to her parents.

This was another great episode from season 11 of South Park . Cartman fakes having Tourette syndrome in order to say whatever he wants without consequences, causing quite the stir at school and in the town. He quickly becomes the face of a documentary focused on children living with this condition, taking full advantage of the newfound attention. Meanwhile, Kyle begins to recognize Cartman's deception and teams up with Stan to expose his friend as a fraud. Through a series of hilariously suspenseful scenes, they unveil Cartman's plot to a shocked community, revealing the deeper impact of his manipulations.

i love this movie. is it on air anymore? what can i do to get it on air again because i miss this movie when does this movie air again? i love this movie so much. does anyone know how long it has been since it was last on Disney?it has been a very very long time and i am so sick of waiting!i want to see Susie Q again. i swear, they take all the good movies off air and play new stupid gay ones that are fake and retarded.

I'm certain that people from USA don't know anything about the rest of the world, but I think they mustn't talk about what they don't know. And they must remember that the rest of the world is not as hypocrite as the USA. The only places where consented sex between teenagers are illegal are the USA and Islamic nations. In France, for instance, the age of consent is 15. In Brazil it's 14. In Spain it's 12. So the teenagers actors, 16 and 17 years old by the time of production, aren't doing anything illegal.

Our Family and friends enjoyed this movie very much. The theme was well handled by the Director with great performances from Shabana Azmi, Konkana Sen and well supported by good performances from the other cast. The climax was built well but for the ending which was a far from being called "Good". We are still trying to understand what was the Director trying to convey? Were they short of ideas or was the ending beyond the understanding of common movie lovers? A better ending would have created a lasting impression on the audience and increased the viewer-ship.

I really think this movie deserves some Oscars ! I really do n't care what people can say badly about it, as it simply exceeded all of my expectations. The exceptional storytelling, brilliant performances from the cast, and stunning cinematography deserve nothing but high praises. I know that there are a variety of opinions and tastes when it comes to movies, but this masterpiece transcended that and truly resonated with me on an emotional level. If any movie has the capability to sweep the awards season, it would definitely be this one. Here's to hoping that it earns the accolades it wholeheartedly deserves!

I'm astounded and dismayed by the number of reviewers on this site who did not get the point of Black Snake Moan. It's not about black/white relationships or old/young relationships, though I think director Craig Brewer deliberately threw in both elements to tweak imagined taboos. It's not about sexual abuse or sex addiction, though Christina Ricci's character, Rae, typifies those. It's not about folk religion in the black community, though religion plays a large role. It's not a love story, though there are not one, but two happy couples at the end.

this is a really great series . i love the show and i am so glad it is n't canceled This is a really great series. I love the show and I am so glad it isn't canceled. It constantly leaves me on the edge of my seat, with exciting storylines and engaging characters. The twists and turns in the plot keep me guessing, and the fantastic acting just brings the whole thing to life. It's rare to find such a consistently high-quality show these days, and it's become an essential part of my weekly viewing routine.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class. The musicianship of this band is amazing and we should all be very thankful we live in a world where Rush exists. Future generations will never be able to see such mastery live and in person. Get this DVD and you will enjoy it throughly!! I was recently able to see these incredible musicians play in Houston, TX and was blown away. I have not missed a show since power windows and I have to say that they are better than ever.

What can you possibly say ? This is the uncut hardcore , musical Alice ! It works too with a spectacular combination of mesmerizing tunes, compelling lyrics, and masterful performances that captivate the soul. Delving deep into the mysterious realms of raw emotions and unparalleled creativity, this musical journey not only redefines genre boundaries, but shatters expectations. From haunting ballads to thumping beats that challenge the status quo, Musical Alice injects a sense of undying wonder and delightful adventure into every listening experience. Every track transcends sonic exploration and proves, yet again, the beauty in the unpredictability of uncut hardcore music.

George Cuckor, known as a director of women, couldn't have hoped for two more talented and beautiful women for his last film. Itself a remake of Bette Davis' campy "Old Acquaintance" written by John Van Druten, this film is definitely dated, but still delightful.Bergen and Bisset sparkle as best friends who compete at everything, but manage to remain friends. Liz Hamilton (Bisset) is a "serious" writer, intellectual, and elegant. She meets her lifelong best friend Merry Noel at an exclusive girls school and they begin a lifetime of not always friendly competition.

GREAT , Chris Diamantopoulos has got to be the best Robim Williams that I have every seen .. He acts just like the late, great comedian, capturing his infectious energy, unique expressions, and quick-witted humor flawlessly. Chris Diamantopoulos truly embodies Robin Williams' spirit in his performance, showcasing a great range of emotion, making you feel as if Robin himself was back on the screen. The versatile talent displayed by Chris brings so much depth to the character, honoring Williams' incredible legacy and inspiring a new generation of viewers. It's no wonder that his portrayal has been lauded by both critics and audiences alike.

Two horse traders arrive in a town and meet up with the leader of a group of Mormons who are bound for a valley where they can settle and live in peace. The scenes of the corral in the town where Ward Bond and Ben Johnson negotiate prices, and Bond introduces the idea of them (Johnson and his partner played by Harry Carey Jr.) leading the train to this valley, are some of the best in the film, as Johnson, a real cowboy, whittles a piece of wood while he banters with Bond.

I 'm not the biggest fan of westerns . My two personal favorites though are Unforgiven , and Tombstone . While I might not be an avid admirer of westerns, these two films have managed to pique my interest and hold a special place in my heart. Unforgiven and Tombstone embody compelling storytelling combined with rich, complex characters, making them standout in this genre. Whether it's the moral ambiguities that unfold throughout Unforgiven or the legendary tales of lawlessness brought to life in Tombstone, I'm always drawn into these mesmerizing worlds.

POSSIBLE SPOILERSNo one is likely to pick up a DVD of Red Dust without knowing that it is about South Africa's Truth and Reconciliation Commission (TRC), and the crimes committed under apartheid. The gripping drama follows human rights lawyer, Sarah Barcant (Hilary Swank), who returns to her homeland to assist a former comrade in his battle to seek justice for the dark past they share. What unfolds is a painful journey, with powerful testimonials and haunting memories, laying bare the reality of living in fear during the oppressive regime.

For my money , probably the best film - or at least the most purely cinematic film - director Ford has ever made is The Searchers (1956). This masterpiece starring John Wayne is not only visually stunning, but it also deals with the depths of the human soul, exploring themes of racism, revenge, and the capacity for redemption. The landscape plays a crucial role, with Monument Valley almost becoming a character in its own right. The exquisite framing and camerawork throughout showcase Ford's distinct aesthetic, which transports viewers into the vast and brutal terrain of the American West.

`` Americans Next Top Model '' is the best reality show ! I was entertained 99.9 percent of the time while watching it. The fierce competition between contestants and the excitement of photoshoots never gets old. The drama, emotion, and surprises on set always leave you on the edge of your seat, anxiously waiting for what's coming next. Apart from pure entertainment, "America's Next Top Model" also educates and inspires those interested in fashion and modeling, making it both entertaining and informative. The top-notch mentors, from Tyra Banks to influential photographers and designers, add valuable input, creating a unique behind-the-scenes experience for viewers.

This is definitely one of the better documentaries I have seen looking at family relationships and marriage. I saw "capturing the friedmans" a short while ago and have to admit I thought this was better.The story is not an incredibly shocking one, but it is a great examination of trapped personalities and relational cold war. Block deftly guides the viewer through diaries, family footage and after-the-fact interviews; his interview style is sensitive and probing, and his insights are clear and measured.51 Birch Street is a great examination of personalities and relationships over 40-50 years of social change, the social fallout, and potential for redemption.

`Skenbart' is one of the funniest movies to not only to come from Peter Dalle but from the Swedish cinema industry itself. It is a movie made in black and white to get something of the atmosphere from the days before Christmas in December 1945, which it does very well. Almost the whole plot takes place on a train, non-stop to Berlin. On the train is a mix of homosexuals, nuns, deported refugees, murderers, alcoholics and the failure literature critic 'Gunnar' played by the, in Sweden, famous actor Gustav Hammarsten.

I have watched this show from the beginning , and I am a 45 year old man . To me , this show transcends age and gender; it is simply a captivating and enjoyable series that has kept me hooked throughout. Over the years, I have eagerly awaited each new episode, immersing myself in the ever-evolving plotlines and relishing the growth of my favorite characters. This show not only sparks conversation with others who share my passion for it, but has also helped me develop valuable insights into complex themes and social issues presented.

This movie makes you think . It shows how a woman 's weaknesses can result in nightmares for others . The film serves as an eye-opening journey, delving deep into the complex psyche of a female protagonist, highlighting the destructive effects her insecurities can unleash on those around her. A powerful blend of suspense and psychological drama, the movie compels the viewer to ponder their own emotional vulnerability and how our weaknesses can have unforeseen consequences for ourselves and others. Undeniably thought-provoking, this cinematic experience will stay etched in the viewer's mind for a long time.

I LOVE this movie . and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore . I think they should definitely bring it back and give the new generation of viewers a chance to appreciate it as much as we did growing up. There are not many films that hold up over time, but this one has a timeless charm and valuable life lessons. Nowadays, it feels like they don't make movies as meaningful and heartfelt as this classic. Reviving it on Disney Channel would not only provide quality entertainment for current viewers, but also reignite nostalgia for older fans.

This was such a great series for Black folks at the time. We loved it so much. It was the only show about Black middle class families on t.v. at the time. Please release this on DVD. I know many...many people who still talk about the show. If it its released i am certain that many black youth will find this enlightening as well as interesting. The show addressed many topics from racism, intra-race discrimination, teen pregnancy, sibling rivalry, single parenting, peer-pressure and much more.

America's Next Top Model is a great reality show in every sense. It has a great hostess, has great guests, a great production and some of the best professionals of the modeling world contributing for something they hadn't achieved yet: present a true America's Next Top Model. Of course this is not something easy to do, therefore USA and the world already would have 10 top models concurring and fighting between themselves in this cruel world.But it's obvious that its intention is not to present the America's next top model, but yes, the America's Next Pop Model.

The Killing Yard is a great film , although uneven at times . Morris Chestnut puts forth a phenomenal effort in portraying a troubled detective navigating a web of deceit, crime, and unexpected plot twists. The film showcases an atmospheric setting that heightens the tension and mystery, giving the audience an immersive experience. However, some character arcs and plot developments can seem forced, undermining the otherwise thrilling narrative. Despite its flaws, The Killing Yard manages to maintain its momentum, thanks to a committed ensemble cast and carefully crafted suspense. Overall, the film provides an engaging experience worth exploring for fans of the crime-thriller genre.

The tunes are the best aspect of this television film which has admittedly better-than-average production values, but very surface and slightly altered biography.
