Dramatizes Richard's discovery of "We've Only Just Begun" and Karen's marriage troubles admirably (the "Superstar" montage was a nice touch), yet notably leaves out the disagreement with Neil Sedaka, the contribution of Tony Peluso's guitar solos, etc. Gibb is sweet in her Karen persona, but it doesn't include the tomboyish and gutsier sides of the real Carpenter's personality.

Eager electronics whiz Brian Foster ( a likable performance by Wesley Eure of TV 's `` Land of the Lost ' fame) unearths an ancient subterranean complex and unintentionally revives an army of deactivated robots. As Brian forms a special bond with one robot, they both begin to learn about trust, friendship, and their mission to protect the world. As the team uncovers new dangers, they encounter other compelling characters who aid in the challenges faced against greedy corporations and devious masterminds. Packed with thrilling action and heartwarming camaraderie, this tale of electronic whizzes and sophisticated AI takes audiences on a futuristic adventure like no other.

The best of everything . Just what is the best of everything ? It is different for everyone but for me, it encompasses a few important factors: balance, fulfillment, and contentment. The best of everything includes finding balance in all aspects of life - work, personal growth, relationships, and health. Striving for fulfillment by setting meaningful goals and seeking happiness in every endeavor, be it in our careers or hobbies. Lastly, embracing a sense of contentment by practicing gratitude for all that we have achieved and understanding that life will never be perfect.

When I saw the preview for this movie, I figured to myself, "here's another dumb TV movie that's written with the thought and complexity of a soap opera," but when I saw it I was surprised. Tiffany-Amber Thiessen stars (and proves that she can indeed act if given the chance) as a woman who falls in love with and marries a man (Now and Again's Eric Close) but begins to lose trust in him when a series of rapes begin to take place in her community.

In "Black Snake Moan," writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me felt like dismissing the entire film as pretentious--a sweltering Southern parable with some oh-so-risky subject matter. The movie also contains a heavy spiritual subtext where religion is being hauled into the picture--again, this is integrated without subtlety. After the darker opening scenes, the film increasingly blunts its edge until the entire production comes off with the artificial quality of a stage play (and I'll admit, the last 15 minutes go way too far into "Happy Ending" territory for my liking).

I guess my husband and I are a little slow. We don't usually warm up to a series until they are almost at the end of their production life. In this case, we didn't start watching KoQs until almost the 6th season. I'm not sure how it escaped our radar for so long. Other than the fact that we are not big fans of "appointment" TV viewing. Our schedules our such that we don't like to commit to watching series every time they come on (and we didn't have a DVR yet).

Ignore the bad reviews on here , this film is awesome ! `` Just Before Dawn '' is a great slasher film that really captures the essence of the horror genre. From the suspenseful moments, chilling score, and talented acting, this film truly delivers on all aspects. Don't be swayed by some negative opinions, because it is clear that the filmmakers put their heart and soul into crafting an enjoyable and thrilling horror experience. Just Before Dawn masterfully builds tension while keeping viewers invested in the story, thanks to its engaging and complex characters.

America's next top model is a good show, it helps people with their careers, but lately i have become bored with it.cycle 1: yeah I'm happy Adrienne won, i wanted her to win from the beginning.cycle 2: its too bad, i think Mercedes deserved it.cycle 3: i did not like Eva, but i did not like most of the girls in this cycle.cycle 4: Kahlen should have won. i don't know what they saw in Naima, but i definitely know what they saw in Kahlen.cycle 5: like cycle 3, this was not a great cycle either.

In one of the many Bugs Bunny-Daffy Duck cartoons , Elmer Fudd is out hunting , and Daffy tries to convince him that it's actually rabbit season, hoping that Elmer will go after Bugs instead of him. As part of his cunning plan, Daffy employs various tactics like swapping signs that say 'Rabbit Season' and 'Duck Season', and putting on disguises to trick Elmer into believing he's someone else. Meanwhile, Bugs, never one to be outsmarted, uses his quick wit to outwit both Daffy and Elmer at every turn.

A quick glance at the premise of this film would seem to indicate just another dumb '80 's inbred/backwood slash-fest Upon further exploration, however, one discovers that this movie transcends the overused tropes often found in typical 80s inbred/backwood slasher films. With a fresh approach to character development, storytelling, and gore, it brilliantly subverts the usual expectations and breathes new life into the subgenre. The director crafts tension and dread through atmosphere, weaving dark humor amidst genuinely terrifying moments. Dynamic visuals combined with a haunting score add to the thrilling experience, solidifying the film as an underappreciated gem within horror cinema.

This film was made soon enough after Karen 's passing that perhaps Richard Carpenter and the people closest to Karen may not have had sufficient distance to critically assess the portrayal of her life. Nonetheless, the movie delves into the singer's struggles with fame, relationships, and her ultimate battle with anorexia. It offers an intimate glimpse into the ups and downs of The Carpenters' career and Karen's tumultuous relationship with her family. While the movie has faced some criticism regarding accuracy and portrayals of certain events, the intention was to raise awareness about eating disorders and honor Karen's talent and legacy.

These guys are excellent and anything they put out to the public is first class . The musicianship of this group is absolutely top-notch, and it is clear that they put their heart and soul into every single performance. From their amazing vocals to their brilliant instrumentation, each member of the band complements one another perfectly, creating a truly cohesive and enchanting musical experience. Not only is their talent evident in their recorded music, but their live performances are an electrifying spectacle. They captivate the audience with their magnetic stage presence, incredible energy, and undeniable charisma.

The entire series , not just The Blue Planet , is nothing short of amazing . The best nature series I've ever come across, it offers breathtaking footage and enlightening insights into the Earth's wildlife and ecosystems. From exploring the vast oceans and the vivid depths of the Blue Planet, to unearthing the undiscovered species in remote, hostile terrains, each episode leaves the audience astounded by the marvels of our planet. Sir David Attenborough's powerful storytelling and ability to explain complex scientific phenomena make these series accessible to everyone. Additionally, it serves as a sobering reminder of the importance of conserving our planet for future generations.

My family and I normally do not watch local movies for the simple reason that they are poorly made , with subpar storylines and amateurish production quality. However, this weekend we decided to give local cinema another chance, hoping for some improvement. To our surprise, we discovered a small gem of a film that captivated us from the very beginning. The movie had well-rounded characters, a strong storyline, and surprisingly good special effects. Its cinematography was excellent, adding depth and enhancing the emotions it invoked. We found ourselves thoroughly entertained and reflecting on our newfound appreciation for local talent.

This was the one movie to see about the Civi War . My aunt actually played in this movie as an extra and always raved about the incredible experience she had on set. Directed by an acclaimed filmmaker, the movie depicted the harsh realities and emotional turmoil faced by the people during the Civil War. It was brought to life by powerful performances, an outstanding script, and spectacular cinematography. Critics and audiences alike praised it for its gripping storyline, historical accuracy, and ability to stir raw emotions in even the most stoic viewer.

With Nurse Betty (2000), acclaimed indie film-maker Neil LaBute (In the Company of Men, Your Friends & Neighbors) makes his breakthrough into the big-budgeted (Betty's $24 million as opposed to Company's measly $25,000), mainstream realm -- and yet remains true to his roots. While his cast is now composed of A-list Hollywood names (Renee Zellweger, Morgan Freeman, and stand-up comedian Chris Rock), his material remains just as bizarre and quirky as his first two features, proving that he just may be the next big thing.

Based on its current IMDb rating as well as several plot summaries , I did n't expect much from 'Two gether'. But I must admit, I was pleasantly surprised. The film goes beyond its basic premise, showcasing a unique and compelling blend of romance, comedy, and genuine human emotions. The performances of the leads are nothing short of captivating, drawing viewers in with their charisma and vulnerability. Their relatable struggles, engaging conversations, and heartfelt moments drive the narrative in a way that feels entirely natural. So if you're in the mood for an unexpectedly enjoyable flick, 'Two-gether' just might be your next pick.

This one started excellently. The photography and audio are the best I've experienced in years (okay, months). Especially the use of 'warm' and 'cold' colours in single sequences is astonishing. Also, making Jennifer Lopez whisper most of her lines is an idea in itself, but I'm not sure what Singh wants to accomplish with that.Now for the minuses. The screenplay was awful. Lopez's part turned out to be irrelevant or totally worthless to the plot. She seemed to star the movie only to sell herself and the pic. The three beds seemed just too obvious.

After a summer full of retreads and disappointments , Nurse Betty is a breath of fresh air . The film , directed by Neil LaBute, is a clever and inventive dark comedy that manages to captivate and entertain from beginning to end. Anchored by a phenomenal performance from Ren√©e Zellweger as Betty, the movie explores the complex world of an amnesiac nurse whose life takes an unexpected and thrilling turn. Alongside an impressive ensemble cast, including Morgan Freeman and Chris Rock, Nurse Betty brings a unique mix of drama, suspense, and satire, providing an escape from the usual clich√©s that tend to dominate summer cinema.

Me and my roommate got free tickets for a Pre Screening I guess you would call it in Atlanta , so we decided to go and check it out. It turned out to be a pre-release of an upcoming movie which made us feel like exclusive guests. The movie turned out to be excellent with gripping story and fantastic performances. Atlanta's film scene was clearly thriving as there were other film enthusiasts buzzing about, discussing and providing insights. After the screening, we got a chance to attend a small Q&A with the director, adding to the whole unforgettable experience.

I have just seen a very original film that I would recommend to everyone including ` the young & the elderly. This refreshing movie skillfully captivates its audience by offering a thought-provoking narrative accompanied by a heartwarming blend of wit and emotion. The movie highlights the importance of strong connections among family, friends, and communities. It takes viewers on an exhilarating ride, filled with stunning visuals, a brilliant score, and unexpected plot twists. It fosters deeper compassion and empathy, delivering valuable life lessons applicable to all ages. A must-watch gem that offers equal measures of entertainment, introspection, and valuable conversations worth having with loved ones.

The Gilmore girls is about a mother who had a daughter when she was 16 . Now the daughter is 16 as well, and together they navigate the trials and tribulations of life in the quirky town of Stars Hollow. The series revolves around the unique bond between mother, Lorelai Gilmore, and daughter, Rory Gilmore, while exploring their evolving relationships with other family members, including their stuffy but loving grandparents, Emily and Richard Gilmore. Throughout the show, the two lead characters encounter love interests, drama, career aspirations, and deal with real-life struggles while building and strengthening their dynamic relationship.

After getting hooked on the mini series , `` North & South , '' I could hardly wait for the sequel to be released. As a die-hard fan of historical dramas, I was captivated by the exceptional character development, the breathtaking scenery, and the heartfelt love story that unfolded throughout the episodes. Each chapter unveiled new complexities, pulling me in deeper into the tangled world of contrasting morals, political turmoil, and unexpected alliances. While eagerly waiting for the next chapter of this epic saga, I became invested in understanding more about the social and cultural landscape that served as the backdrop to the show.

This if the first movie I 've given a 10 to in years . If there was ever a movie that truly deserves a perfect score, it's this one. The powerful storyline gripped me from start to finish, providing a rollercoaster of emotions as we were immersed in a world brilliantly portrayed on screen. The characters were intricately developed, leaving audiences deeply invested in their journey. Superb performances, along with visually stunning cinematography, come together seamlessly to create a captivating masterpiece. I believe this movie has set the bar high for filmmaking in years to come and I wholeheartedly recommend it as a must-watch for all cinephiles.

Alright so this episode makes fun of Al Gore. I'm sure it pisses a few liberals off. The thing is South Park makes fun of everybody, much like the Simpsons did. If you get offended that a politician you like is made fun of then maybe you need a better sense of humor and are taking the show too seriously. With that being said this episode is hilarious and one of the best. Al Gores portrayal is hilarious, Cartman's scheme goes terribly wrong and the results will have you rolling on the floor laughing.

Clich√©-avoidance is one of this film 's main achievements . When you hear a vague outline of the story ¬ñ a troubled protagonist struggling to find redemption amidst challenging circumstances ‚Äì you might think it's just another overused plot. But the filmmakers breathe new life into this age-old tale by presenting it with remarkable ingenuity and refreshing nuances. Every twist feels entirely unexpected, making us reimagine what is truly original in storytelling. Exceptional performances combined with impeccable pacing propel the narrative, turning hackneyed situations into invigorating moments of emotional power. The result is a captivating, genre-defying masterpiece that redefines our perception of predictability in cinema.

The hurried approach that Lewis Seiler takes with King of the Underworld establishes a deeper plot , while still maintaining the fast-paced energy essential to this 1939 crime drama film. Through skillful direction, Seiler effortlessly immerses the viewer in a world of cunning criminals and unyielding law enforcement, painting a rich tapestry of intrigue and suspense. As we delve into the intricacies of the underworld, characterized by its many complexities and layered power dynamics, the director remains steadfast in balancing character development and the compelling action sequences that have come to define this period in American cinema.

I just started watching The Show around July . I found it by mistake , I was channel surfing during a slow afternoon when I suddenly stumbled upon it. At first, I didn't think I'd like it, but I was instantly drawn in by the interesting plot and captivating characters. It was like stepping into a whole new world full of intrigue and excitement. As I continued to watch each episode, I realized that I had been missing out on this amazing show for years. Now, I find myself eagerly anticipating every new episode, discussing the storyline and character development with fellow fans online.

I'd honestly give this movie a solid 7.5, but I clicked 10 to try to offset the 5 pages of imbecilic, unjustified 1-star reviews. This is an interesting story, all of the acting is good to very good (even Ms. Diaz, who is totally out of her usual grinning-bimbo role here, yet plays it well.) The sets are perfect and the cinematography is consistently appropriately creepy. It's a fine morality play and there is *no* reason to explain the origin of the god/supernatural being/alien/whatever that's "running the show," so I'm glad the movie doesn't try.

Despite all it's trappings of style and cinematic invention, this is basically another serial killer thriller, following the same sort of plotline favoured by such old favourites as Silence of the Lambs ? team of cops follows the trail of (particularly nasty) murders, someone else gets taken and they somehow have to find out where they are before it's too late. Only in this case, the only person who knows, the killer himself (powerfully played by Vincent D'Onofrio) is in a coma and we need psychologist Jennifer Lopez' sci-fi mind-meld machine to get into his head and force him to tell all.

It's funny because I read all the reviews on this page after getting this movie and it's either a love it or hate it reaction. You'll probably either love it or hate it too. I think the best films are the ones that divide people because obviously they have some kind of impact. I'm in the five star camp because this film did a real number on me and made me want to go back and find out more about Afghanistan and Iraq. I have to admit that I was pretty tuned out when all that was taking place.

I 'm not gon na lie . To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot. In fact, it's an absolute mind-bender that keeps you guessing and questioning long after the credits roll. The convoluted plot seems intentionally designed to disorient and confound, taking audiences on an epic journey through time and space. The astounding visuals only serve to add to the captivating chaos, while the riveting performances draw you in even more. Like staring directly at the blazing sun, attempting to fully grasp this film will only result in squinting eyes and potential burnout.

Had the pleasure to see this film at the Big Bear Film Festival where it won the Audience Award. And I have to say, it was well deserved because Boy Next Door is a very funny short film! The script is well written and keeps things escalating. It also has a great current of suspense coursing through it. You don't know what's going to happen next as the main character tries to deal with the realization that his new neighbor might not be the most ideal person to be living across from him. The jokes are quick and unexpected.

I watched the first few moments on TCM a few years ago but stopped after about 15 minutes . I just couldn't get into the storyline or connect with the characters at that time. However, recently, a friend of mine highly recommended the movie to me, mentioning that it was their all-time favorite. So, I decided to give it another try, thinking that perhaps I wasn't in the right headspace the first time I attempted to watch it. As I pressed play and settled in, I tried to remain open-minded and patient.

Okay I marked this spoiler so do n't be upset when I wrap this up . Now I went into the movie with high expectations, given all the hype surrounding it, and let me tell you, it didn't disappoint! The twists and turns of the plot kept me on the edge of my seat, and the character development was just outstanding. The visuals were absolutely stunning and the sound effects totally immersive. As for the ending, it was as emotional and impactful as I had hoped it would be. Kudos to the actors and crew for their splendid work.

There is a clever little scene in The Karen Carpenter Story, where both Carpenters are in a recording studio, and Richard makes an impromptu decision to have Karen sing for the owner of the studio.Richard picks the wrong key for Karen to sing in, so Karen is singing above her natural range. You can see a look of bemusement on the owner's face; he figures she really can't sing. Richard quickly realizes his mistake and tries again in a different key. The next thing you hear is Karen's amazing, beautiful voice, and the owner does a priceless double take.

Blue Planet ... Wow ... Where do I begin ? The years of hard work paid off in what is undoubtedly an incredible journey into the depths of our Earth's oceans. Blue Planet never ceases to amaze and inspire, revealing the fascinating, intricate, and often unexpected lives of underwater creatures. Narrated by the iconic voice of Sir David Attenborough, this ground-breaking documentary series invites us all to marvel at the complexity, beauty, and majesty of marine ecosystems. Moreover, it highlights the undeniable importance of preserving and nurturing our aquatic habitats, whilst instilling in us a profound respect and appreciation for life on this magnificent, blue planet.

i love this show! it is amazing...i can never miss an episode even if i've already seen it. the actors are perfect for the parts......i love Gilmore girls! i've gotten all my friends to watch it. even their parents watch it now. i watch it daily and i usually watch it more than once a day. i wish my mom was like Lorelei. my friends say that i talk and act like Lorelei. Lorelei and Rory have a wonderful mother-daughter relationship. it is a great teen show because they actually kind of learn from watching it.

I wanted to watch this, to get a inside look at the show. It told the story more of Robin Williams, then Mork & Mindy. Still, thought it was great. We got to see, Robin always being 'on', no matter what. The performance of Diamontopolous was awesome.The introductions of the main players, seem so real to me. Roebuck as Garry Marshall was wonderful. He was so charming in this, which helped me get through all the Williams energy. The little behind the scenes pieces of his other shows (Happy Days, and Laverne & Shirley), was enlightening.

King of Queens is comic genius . Kevin James , whom plays IPS deliveryman Doug Heffernan is extremely funny , especially when paired with the sassy Leah Remini, who plays his headstrong wife Carrie Heffernan. Their interactions together make the show consistently laugh-out-loud, showcasing both of their unique comedic skills. Supporting characters such as their unconventional neighbors and Doug's bumbling friends at IPS add to the humorous dynamic, creating quirky storylines with many side-splitting moments. Combined with expertly-written dialogue, well-executed physical comedy, and expert comedic timing, King of Queens has become an undeniable television classic, leaving audiences doubled over with laughter for over two decades.

Up And Coming was a very positive sitcom, which brought a tool/and or channel that opened the young minds of the Black Culture. The focus and outlook was a message of positivity for our people, and hope for change. I advise this selection for every American household to experience the struggle, and the reward. The show was never given the chance to blossom into the idea of middle-class Blacks becoming business owners of their own. The issue's were so compatible with real life situation's that impacted the lives of so many.

In `` Black Snake Moan , '' writer-director Craig Brewer is so obsessed with heavy symbolism that part of me wonders if he has forgotten to focus on the essence of the story itself. Characters and visuals are so deeply drenched in metaphor that they occasionally drown the genuine emotion of the narrative. Furthermore, the complex themes explored may leave some audience members feeling unsettled, questioning the true intention behind Brewer's vision. Although these narrative issues cannot be overlooked, there's no denying the powerful performances by Samuel L. Jackson, Christina Ricci, and Justin Timberlake that anchor the film.

I own the miniseries on DVD because I love this story so much . This is one of the best adaptations of the classic tale, which keeps me captivated and entertained every time I watch it. The excellent casting, combined with the compelling screenplay and the astounding cinematography, bring the narrative to life in a visually stunning manner. The chemistry between the characters and the immersive historical atmosphere effortlessly draw me into the intricacies of the story. Not only does it stay true to the essence of the original literary work, but the miniseries also elevates it, taking viewers on a breathtaking and emotional journey.

Loved the shots of airports -- Dallas , Phoenix , Fresno , etc. , just single buildings with the name of the city plastered on them, standing proudly amidst sprawling runways and bustling terminals. These symbols of modern aviation displayed both the vast scale of infrastructure, as well as the unity brought by interconnectivity, no matter the city size. Capturing various aircraft soaring above iconic destinations illuminated the very essence of air travel. It is more than just jet-setting and mile-high sights, but an ongoing narrative of places once distant, now tethered by human ingenuity and determination, fostering collaboration, globalisation, and personal experiences across myriad frontiers.

After searching for 6 months , I finally found this DVD . All I can say is it was damn worth the wait! The plot, characters, and visuals all came together to create an amazing cinematic experience that truly left an impact. This hidden gem had me immersed from the very first scene, keeping me on the edge of my seat throughout its thrilling narrative. It's remarkable that a DVD like this still exists in today's digital era, giving us a chance to enjoy films from the past. After countless streaming disappointments, stumbling upon this masterpiece really made my search worthwhile.

This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew , a narrative depth superior to most novels , wonderful music This epic brings together a superbly-gifted cast and crew, a narrative depth superior to most novels, wonderful music that will captivate your senses, and awe-inspiring cinematography that will transport you to a whole new world. The director expertly weaves together intricate plotlines and dynamic, relatable characters that will make your emotions soar to new heights, as you fully immerse yourself in this grand tale. This cinematic masterpiece pushes the boundaries of storytelling and brings a visual experience like no other, guaranteed to be remembered and cherished for generations to come.

Daffy Duck has signs hanging from every inch of every available tree announcing that it's rabbit season. But, you guessed it - it's really duck season. Elmer Fudd appears: he's the only hunter dumb enough to fall for the gag.He's even dumber than that. When Bugs Bunny strides up to him and asks how the rabbit hunting is going, Elmer admits that he hasn't seen a rabbit yet. This is more than Daffy can stand. He emerges from his hiding place and immediately points to a rabbit: Bugs Bunny. "Shoot him now!"

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings. In Europe for example we've had years of war and though one nation could never eradicate the other, the old enemies always ended living next to each other or WITH each other at the end of the conflict. In the US, the immigrants white population exterminated the aboriginal population to near extinction. the US citizen never had to live with its enemy. This explains in my view the often simplistic nature of Hollywood movie when they try and explain a foreign country's strife.

"Two Hands" is a good addition to the Australian Film Catalogue.It is that curious mix of real life, surreal life, comedy, tragedy and love the Australians have developed on their own.Heath Ledger is basically a good if naive guy. Wanting to get on he falls in with a local "Big" Man Pando (Bryan Brown). But at the very moment he sets a first toe on the dark path to crime he meets Alex (Rose Byrne). Here is the cause of the error to change his life in ways unexpected.

Maybe it 's just a personal affection for this screen version of the Mika Waltari novel , or a fondness for historical epics, but this adaptation captivates me every time I watch it. Directed by Michael Curtiz, the film expertly showcases the grandiosity of ancient Egypt while remaining true to Waltari's masterpiece. The exceptional cinematography, magnificent set design, and powerful performances by Jean Simmons and Victor Mature are truly spellbinding. Furthermore, the sweeping storyline delves into love, betrayal, political intrigue, and self-discovery, all themes that resonate universally.

After searching for 6 months, I finally found this DVD. All I can say is it was damn well worth the wait! "Rush in Rio" may very well be the greatest rock DVD in existence. I'm not joking. It's incredible! All the fuss about the sound being crappy is true, however it doesn't make the concert unwatchable. I find it makes you feel like you're actually in Rio watching the concert from the audience. That's one of the reasons I love this DVD. It makes you feel like you're actually there.

It happens often, while growing up, a Hollywood movie impresses a youth. It not only lasts a lifetime, but inspire him to study ancient cultures as a career. Such was the case, with the 1954 film entitled "The Egyptian." Audience were awed with the sets, costumes and great acting of this film, so much so, other films soon followed in like vain. This is the story of a young Egyptian boy who was left parent less soon after he was born. With such a dubious beginning, it is not hard to wonder why he will spend his life, asking questions.

A classic late 50 's film . The superannuated headliners ( Joan Crawford and Louis Jordan ) are not at their best, yet there is a certain nostalgic charm in witnessing their last performances together. Set in a picturesque post-war European backdrop, the storyline unravels the love triangle involving an aging actress, a charming pianist, and an opportunistic manager. With authentic 50's costuming and jazzy background score, the film is worth watching for enthusiasts who cherish classic romantic melodramas. Though marred by slightly overwrought acting and uneven pacing, the on-screen chemistry between Crawford and Jordan ensures an entertaining spectacle.

I get really fed up with sitcoms; you feel you always know what is coming so it ceases to be funny. On the other hand, Hi De Hi, you rarely know what is coming and it's laugh out loud funny. I have just purchased the second set of the series, (series 3 -4)and I am surprised at just how much I am enjoying it all - again. I have nothing but praise for the writers or the actors (or the many unseen crew members) because the entertainment they provide is well worth the wait.

I'm surprised by some of the comments on this site because I really liked this film. If you're looking for something different then this movie is a good choice. Definitely not your typical mindless story that seems to be everywhere starring Ben Idiot Affleck or some other Hollywood loser. It's an intellectual film, you actually need to pay attention so some people might be turned off by that. However, if you are looking for something that keeps you on your toes then this is a good choice. Warning to parents - it has some fairly graphic sex scenes so watch it once the kiddies are in bed.

I bought this movie because of Raquel Welch . She was gorgeous in this film as she played the role of an alluring seductress named Fathom. The movie itself was a fun, action-packed adventure set in exotic locales with a perfect blend of thrilling spy elements and campy humor. The supporting cast delivered great performances as well, especially Tony Franciosa, who portrayed a witty and charming hero alongside Raquel's mesmerizing character. Overall, the film boasts amazing cinematography and eye-catching wardrobe choices, making it a delightful feast for the eyes. It's no wonder that Fathom has achieved a well-deserved status as a classic, escapist treat from the '60s.

This film blew me away. I thought I knew a little about the Attica prison riot. After watching this, I see I knew nothing. The story is told through the relationship between the attorney and the black inmate. Both the personal story of these two men and the unfolding courtroom drama were riveting. The flashback sequences in the prison were awesome. It's hard to believe it wasn't documentary footage it was so real. It was not only a great piece of drama, it was an incredible lesson in an important chapter in American history. I'm with Ebert and Roeper.

i love this movie . is it on air anymore ? what can i do to get it on air again? I absolutely need to watch it one more time! I wonder if any of the streaming platforms have it available in their catalogues, or maybe I could find it on digital platforms like Google Play or Amazon Prime. If those options fail, perhaps a classic DVD or Blu-ray from a local store could be the way to go! I'll start searching around, reach out to fellow fans, and even post about it on social media to gather information on how to bring this amazing movie back into my life.

this is a really great series. i love the show and i am so glad it isn't canceled yet. it has really good humor and shows the realistic bond between a young mother and her daughter. o yes for Gilmore girls! it is very awesome. they are such a sarcastic humorous bunch. they do everything together just like my mom and me. ya for Gilmore girls. um, i'm running out of lines. but i love how Luke and Lorelei's relationship is finally shaping up. they so needed to be together. and i absolutely just love Sookie St. James!

When this film gets it right it really gets it right . And when it goes wrong ... I 'd rather not discuss those parts. Nevertheless, this movie showcases moments of brilliance, captivating the audience with riveting performances and enthralling visuals. It manages to shine amidst some frustrating narrative decisions, highlighting the potential for a truly outstanding cinematic experience. However, inconsistency rears its ugly head, undermining the storytelling and taking viewers on a bumpy rollercoaster ride that is both enjoyable and exasperating. The highs overshadow the lows, but it's hard not to ponder what could have been if the film stayed consistent throughout.

What can I say ? You expect only the best in drama from the BBC and MESSIAH is not an exception. This gripping and intense crime thriller series, brought to you by the renowned British broadcaster, only elevates the standards we've come to love and expect. Boasting superb storytelling, compelling character development, and heart-stopping suspense, MESSIAH plunges us deep into the chaotic world of murder, secrets, and betrayal. Each episode leaves us not only hungry for more but also pondering on the human psyche and the disturbing extents to which people can go.

I saw this movie when I was a lot younger but it captured me . I loved Orry and George 's deep-rooted friendship despite their differences in beliefs and upbringing. The film brilliantly depicted their strong bond as they navigated the hardships of life during the Civil War era. The amazing cast delivered exceptional performances, transporting the audience back in time, and the love triangle involving Orry, George, and Madeline added an extra layer of intensity to the plot. The movie was a true rollercoaster of emotions and left me appreciating the power of loyalty and friendship during challenging times.

Just Before Dawn came out during the golden days of the slasher film. The backwoods slasher pretty much started with films like Friday the 13th, The Burning, and Madman. Just Before Dawn is a step ahead of the typical backwoods slasher flick. The cinematography is gorgeous. The acting is top notch. The heroine of the film is not your typical 'final girl'.Constance is a 'woods' girl, but when it comes down to the primal instinct of survival, she's a step behind. Not until it comes to saving the life of her and her boyfriend, does the primal notion of survival kick in.

I would give this movie high marks for the cinema-photography and performances . I just read a user comment concerning the film's plot, which mentioned that it felt a little confusing and underdeveloped. While I understand that perspective, I personally felt that the intricacy and subtle nuances in the storytelling added a certain depth to the film that is rarely seen in today's cinema. Despite a few minor flaws, this movie excelled in immersing the audience in its well-crafted world, supported by powerful acting and striking visuals. It leaves you with thought-provoking questions and creates room for passionate discussion among viewers, making it an excellent film for movie aficionados.

This movie was so cool ! I saw it on a Friday night with a couple of my friends . The whole experience was amazing, as we all couldn't stop talking about the thrilling plot, breathtaking visuals, and engaging characters throughout. There were so many unexpected twists and turns that we were literally at the edge of our seats, devouring our popcorn. The remarkable special effects blew us away, making the film an absolute feast for the eyes. After the movie, we hit the nearby diner for a quick snack and couldn't resist dissecting every epic moment in detail.

Well , okay , maybe not perfect , but it was pretty close . This movie jumped from crime drama to thrilling action, intertwining suspense and character development seamlessly. The gripping storyline held my attention from beginning to end, showcasing a series of twists that had me constantly second-guessing myself. The actors delivered compelling performances, truly bringing the diverse and nuanced characters to life. The realistic dialogue allowed the audience to truly understand their motivations and emotional depth. Cinematography, meanwhile, complemented the tone and feel of the narrative, with attention to details that enhanced the immersive experience.

I liked this a lot. The camera angles are cool, it's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch. And I thought they did a great job with the Sound when we see things from Kane's point of view. Lots of fun. Plenty of people were shouting at the screen! Kane did a great job with his various psycho emotions. He's a lot less one-dimensional than most horror heroes.Kane is a lot less scary and more believable than most movie psychos. It was not clear to me how he would react to various situations.

In a time of bad, if not plain awful, comedies, King of Queens is more than just a breath of fresh air, it's a complete oxygen tank! It is in my opinion one of the 5 best comedy shows of all times. Nothing has been this good since Married with Children. Kevin James and Jerry Stiller are comic geniuses! And believe me, it takes a lot to make me label someone as comic genius. These guys truly understand what is funny. I could watch ten episodes of Seinfeld and wouldn't get half the laughs from seeing KOQ just once.

Please be aware that this film has nothing to do with the Radio City Music Hall! As an archivist re: the Music Hall..I know what is and what is not associated with the New York venue. The film's Theodore is just the "Music Hall." No Rockettes are in the film. Only wonderful ice skaters plus superb actors and fun. Just thought you would like to know. Truly a wonderful film. You will never guess who the 'murderer' is while watching this film....till the very end. What a superb plot and beautiful ice skating.

I saw Riverdance - The New Show and loved it from the very first moment! It is an energetic tribute to Irish dance filled with brilliant dancing, music and choreography! The leads, Jean Butler and Colin Dunne had me captivated with their exquisite dancing! May they always keep shining and keep dancing. Their on stage chemistry was amazing, and the unity between them on stage was obvious. They look like they were made to dance with each other! This show is my absolute favourite, and probably always will be. Long Live Riverdance!

`` Boy Next Door '' is a hilarious romp through male neurosis . In just over fifteen minutes , the film masterfully explores the anxieties, fears, and foibles of its protagonist, as he desperately navigates the challenges of dating, relationships, and dealing with the ever-daunting 'girl next door.' Brilliantly using visual gags and witty dialogues, the film weaves a tale that anyone who's ever faced the daunting task of talking to their crush can relate to. Boy Next Door provides its audience with equal parts empathy and laughter, as our bumbling hero struggles to make sense of his love life and, more importantly, himself.

Text Taken from 2001 Melbourne International Film Fest Guide.fuckland The title is a pun based on the film 's lead character, who happens to be named Luck. Luck, an unassuming young man, embarks on an odyssey across the Australian Outback, crossing paths with an eccentric ensemble of outcasts and misfits. The diverse encounters allow him to reflect upon the challenges and triumphs that shaped his world. Shot amid the wild terrain and vast landscapes, Fuckland exudes raw realism, painting a bleak yet poetic picture of society's disenfranchised souls, all trying to forge their paths within an indifferent universe.

Well ..... I would n't want to lecture anybody but I do feel the urge to say some things I believe are important. In today's fast-paced world, we often overlook the value of empathy and human connections. People are getting more focused on their personal achievements, often neglecting their relationships and social interactions. Communication technology, while having various advantages, can never replace face-to-face conversations and meaningful interactions. So, let's all make a conscious effort to understand each other's perspective and be more compassionate, setting aside our judgments.

Tex Avery's tenure as director of cartoons for MGM was in the 1940s and 50s was one of the brightest moments in cartoon history. His cartoons were exceptionally inventive and surreal with MANY weird touches that were later celebrated in the movie THE MASK. Eyes popping out when a guy sees a girl, impossible stunts and non-stop action were the trademarks of these films.This is one of several Droopy cartoons that Avery was responsible for and it's among his best. Droopy is a Mountie and he is determined to get his man,...though in this case it's a wolf who has escaped from prison.

This is what porn used to be , this is a true classic . I mean , it is an oldie but a goldie! This true classic comes from a time when erotica had a charm of its own - more storylines, seduction, and, surprisingly, it seems more realistic. This isn't like the content that is produced nowadays where everything seems to be overtly sensationalized. Rather, this was more about the slow burn, the palpable chemistry, the tantalizing situations, all culminating into a symphony of sultry experiences that take us back to those early days when we first dared to peek into the risqu√© world of pornography.

The first thing I wanted to do after watching this film was watch it again ( because I 'd missed some of the details and layers that added to the brilliance of its storytelling). The immersive world, gripping narrative, and multifaceted characters left an indelible impression on my mind. I found myself deeply engrossed in each frame and astounded by the fine interplay of subtleties in both the visuals and the score. Beyond its technical prowess, the movie tapped into profound and thought-provoking themes that compelled me to ponder its deeper meanings. A remarkable work of art, it has earned a permanent spot on my list of favorites.

I 'm not usually into dark/psychological thriller type things . However , SEIZING ME is really an amazing piece of writing that has captured my attention from the start. This intense, captivating novel has kept me on the edge of my seat, taking me down a twisting path that never ceased to surprise me. The characters are fascinating, deeply developed, and almost feel uncomfortably real at times, drawing you deeper into their minds and the plot's labyrinth. The writing is enthralling and meticulously crafted, with just the right balance of suspense and shock, leading to a psychological exploration that is simply hard to put down.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary , it is obviously a labor of love and dedication. This powerful and poignant film takes us on an unforgettable journey through the intricacies of a particular time in history, effortlessly shedding light on its long-lasting impact. The depth of research is astounding and it reflects in the immersive storytelling that unveils compelling accounts from primary sources, thoughtfully backed up by evidence. The raw emotions captured make the viewer feel empathetic and well-informed, with multiple perspectives creating an overarching understanding of the situation.

Every time I watch this show I just want to turn it off and curse the makers for wasting my time week after week. The dialogs, or monologues rather, as everybody just rants on endlessly about nothing, are just becoming so tedious. For example, the episode I watched yesterday began with a seemingly unending rambling about how a particular dish (I forgot what it was, pasta with meatballs perhaps) always manages to turn the Gilmore family dinner into all-out war. And these were just the few seconds or so.So it seems every time, lots of lines, with absolutely zero content.

This is a very well done film showing the life of international students during their `` Erasmus year '' in Barcelona. The film expertly captures the unique challenges and unforgettable experiences that international students encounter as they embark on their Erasmus journey. Through the relatable, multidimensional characters, it highlights the difficulties of language barriers, adapting to a new culture, and the search for accommodation in an unfamiliar city. Moreover, the movie does an excellent job of demonstrating the significance of friendships formed and the beauty of diversity in such an environment.

I LOVE this movie. and Disney channel is ridiculous for not playing it anymore. I think they should definitely put Susie Q back on the air at least one night so we can record it!!! but if not does anyone know where I can find it?? my email is cristin6891@aim.com please email me if you know where i can find this movie. Online, or anywhere. I told my kids about this movie and i think that they deserve to see it also. All these Disney movies that are coming out now are fake and boring.

Two Hands is a highly enjoyable Aussie crime caper, which ultimately succeeds by the way the film easily combines tense dramatic moments, with very funny characters and situations, to give the film the right balance and feel. The comedy of the film occurs naturally, and the laughs haven't been set up too elaborately & haven't been too worked at. It really is very funny, thanks to the fact that each character in the movie is excellently cast, and that each actor/actress recognises and can relate to the Aussie humor. They portray it very well and very realistically.

Every time I hear Karen Carpenter's voice, there is that old familiar feeling of 70's blues. What an overwhelmingly beautiful and mature voice she had. Cynthia Gibb cast in the title role does a good job, however, I thought Karen Allen would have been a better choice. This is a tearjerker movie that does a fine job of presenting the professional careers of Karen and Richard but also the personal struggles that Karen dealt with and her disease. The recording sessions in Herp Albert's studio are very nicely done.

Forget about the plot of this movie . Forget about the fact that it is wonderfully acted by Vince Vaughn and the supporting cast. Instead, focus on the underlying themes and emotions presented throughout the film. Delving deep into the realms of friendship, loyalty, and personal struggle, this film captivates audiences and pulls at the heartstrings with a stunning narrative that transcends the events taking place on the surface. Coupled with a beautifully crafted visual style and evocative soundtrack, it ultimately delivers a profound cinematic experience that reminds us of our own vulnerabilities, our shared connections, and the often underestimated impact of human emotions in our lives.

After seeing Meredith in `` Beyond the Prairie '' I had to buy another film with her staring . I came across "Storm of Suspicion" and knew I had to watch it. Meredith's performance in this suspense-filled drama was nothing short of fantastic. It was intriguing to witness the remarkable transformation from her innocent portrayal in "Beyond the Prairie" to a powerful, commanding presence in "Storm of Suspicion." Once again, Meredith succeeded in captivating the audience with her undeniable talent and convincing portrayal of a character entangled in a web of mystery and deceit.

Well its a great work by Aparnaji and some where people like this makes us believe that there is a ray of hope in this chaotic world. It's heartening to see that there are still individuals, like Aparnaji, who go out of their way to bring about positive change in the lives of the underprivileged. Such acts of selflessness remind us of the power of humanity, and show us that we can collectively make this world a better place. As more people come forward and engage in philanthropic endeavors like these, our collective strength grows, demonstrating the sheer importance of kindhearted individuals in restoring harmony to our society.

15 PARK AVENUE is the address `` Mithi/Mithali '' ( Konkona ) is in search for from the movies beginning to the very end. This search takes the audience through Mithi's emotional and psychological journey, as she relentlessly seeks a seemingly non-existent home. She remains confident that this mystical residence is where her true happiness and peace reside. Mithi, portrayed beautifully by Konkona, delves deeper into her subconscious and self-made reality as her determination intensifies. The viewers, while experiencing a gripping storyline, are also given a deeper insight into the delicate nature of the human mind and the overwhelming desire for solace and belonging.

I liked this a lot . The camera angles are cool , it 's not all jumpy like a Blair Witch Project or something. The acting is quite impressive, as the actors seem genuinely engrossed in their roles, making the audience feel truly invested in the story. Additionally, the editing is clean and smooth, allowing the film to progress seamlessly. The sound design and score effectively elevate the intensity, adding to the overall immersive experience. While the plot could benefit from a bit more development, it is still engaging and offers several surprising twists.

Even for sci-fi this movie is movie is a little out there . Alright , more than a little ... Even for sci-fi, this movie is a little out there. Alright, more than a little, it's a full-blown rollercoaster of bizarre concepts and outlandish ideas that will have your head spinning. Set in an alternate universe, with extraordinary creatures and inexplicable phenomena, it leaves audiences scratching their heads as they attempt to follow the twisting narrative. Blending reality with fantasy, it's an incredible fusion of advanced technology, improbable events, and impossible worlds.

10 respected directors each shot a short film with operatic arias as the inspiration ( and music ) . I had the wonderful opportunity to attend a screening of this cinematic masterpiece that seamlessly weaves together the world of film and opera. The featured directors' diverse perspectives led to the creation of an innovative and visually striking tapestry, as each short brought its unique interpretation of the iconic arias. Emotion, passion, and intensity filled the auditorium as viewers were drawn into every story, experiencing the emotional nuances expressed through powerful vocal performances, engaging narratives, and artful cinematography.

Yes, this is one of the better done television movies and I wouldn't expect less from Joe Sargent. One thing for this reviewer is that I was also a great fan of The Carpenters, I got to sing all of their material in elementary school and middle school choir and I got to do much of the solo material of which Karen sang lead. I thought she was one of the most wonderful pop singers of the 70's - and being a child/teen singing these songs and learning music - the one thing I was looking forward to was meeting this woman.

The trailer to this film focused so much on the chain ( of course , because it 's so sensational ), that it almost seemed as though the chain was the star. But as viewers delve deeper into the story, it becomes evident that the film is about much more than just an attention-grabbing prop. This dark, psychological thriller unravels the hidden traumas of each character, where the infamous chain represents the inescapable hold the past has over them. Emotions and personal struggles collide, leaving audiences pondering the impact of destructive tendencies on relationships and, ultimately, on oneself.

This was an excellent show. It came on PBS back home in Chicago and I remember Cindy Herron (From EnVogue) played the teen aged daughter. The show dealt with subjects such as sex, peer pressure and puberty. IT was about a middle class black family who had a teen aged daughter and son who moved to a middle class neighborhood from Oakland or somewhere (I can't remember). I remember several episodes but the one I remember most was when their cousin got her period for the first time. I was probably 7-8 when I first watched it and I was able to keep up with the program.

Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally , a true Colombian film crosses the border ( s ) to shows how Hallelujah ! ! ! ! Finally, a true Colombian film crosses the border(s) to show the world the incredible talent and culture our nation has to offer. This captivating masterpiece effortlessly highlights our nation's captivating landscapes and offers a true depiction of the richness of Colombian lifestyle. Tackling complex societal issues and promoting local folklore, the film presents a refreshingly honest and authentic portrayal of our people. The talented actors and filmmakers invite international audiences to explore and appreciate Colombia in a way they've never seen before.

The show is GREAT. No words to describe it. Wonderful music. Incredible dance. The editors couldn't spoil it, not because they were not *that*bad*, but because the show is really *that*good*.The editors are compulsive cutters, you can't see a scene without a cut for more than 15 secs. It's OK to show various angles, but those guys were working with multiple cameras for the first time in their lives, and they will remind you of how many cameras they have every five seconds on average...

This movie is complex and interesting in so many ways . It is a non stop plethora of emotion and intrigue that continuously leaves viewers on the edge of their seats. From heart-pounding action sequences to profound character development, this film explores various themes such as love, friendship, revenge, and forgiveness. The stunning visual effects and impeccable direction are complemented by a remarkable soundtrack that further immerses audiences into the intricately woven narrative. Ultimately, the thought-provoking nature and riveting plot twists of the film ensure a captivating cinematic experience that resonates long after the credits roll.

Wow! An amazing, lost piece of Australiana AND a lost 70s glam-rock film rolled into one. This film warrants viewing simply to see what can be done with next to no budget but a lot of enthusiasm. As a retelling of the Oz story, the film borders on becoming too obvious but it is saved by it's eccentricities. The chance for a glimpse at how glam rock manifested in Australia will delight fans of the genre. This film used to be double featured with the Rocky Horror Picture Show, an indicator of the type of film that Oz is.

I remember seeing the trailer for this movie when it was first released and it looked pretty cool. I never got the chance to see it though. When I went to Blockbuster to rent some videos, I figured I should watch it. After all I did love "Silence of the Lambs" and "Se7en", and if you enjoyed those movies, you might get a kick out of "The Cell". The whole story concept is very interesting. Going physically into the mind of a killer, I can't imagine the world they live in.

I had the pleasure to view this film when I was 10 years old,(having an existing interest in Egyptology). I know that there are subtle mistakes to the art direction and costuming, but over all this is the best film, to date with the look of the 18th dynasty.The film only approximates Mika Walteri's "The Egyptian", in plot. A good portion of the text never made it to film, as we have to consider the running length.The music score by B. Hermann and Alfred Newman is beautiful!!! Performances as follows.

`` Jaded '' takes on the complex question of abuse : the perpetrators and the victims . In lesser hands , this theme could easily have resulted in a cliched and one-dimensional portrayal. However, the nuanced storytelling skillfully delves into the various forms of abuse ‚Äì emotional, physical, and psychological ‚Äì offering a deeply layered and introspective look at the characters involved. By showing the intertwining dynamics between abusers and their victims, as well as the difficult paths towards healing, "Jaded" explores the intricacies of power and control, ultimately shining a light on the resilience and potential redemption for both parties involved.

I have remembered this cartoon for over 50 years - what staying power it has ! It was funny and engaging, yet still had a moral lesson woven into its plot. The vibrant animation and quirky characters captured my imagination and heart as a young child, making it a nostalgic masterpiece. These memorable episodes always provided endless entertainment and clever, thought-provoking storylines that stand the test of time. In today's world, where animation continues to push boundaries and technological advances, revisiting this cartoon classic reminds us that the magic lies in the characters, storytelling, and heartwarming lessons it delivers.

The Reader is an exceptionally well done and very sweet short. Every element of the piece assists in eliciting a pure emotional response to the script. Well acted, directed, shot and written. I was surprised to hear that there was no rehearsal before shooting, not even a read through. The performances stand as testament to some fine instinctual acting in response to a well written script. The actresses work was excellent and there was never an indication that their work would slip into the purely sentimental. Less is much better in this case.

I'm not gonna lie. To say that this movie is confusing is like saying the sun is hot but not really. And if you've seen cult director Richard Kelly's previous films, "Donnie Darko" and "Southland Tales," you know that's gotta mean something. When I went to see this movie, there were about 50 people in the theater. Before an hour into the film, about half of the audience had already walked out. By the end, there were only 15 people left wondering what in the hell did they just see.

The year 1950 saw two very different and interesting westerns: 'The Gunfighter' by Henry King, and 'Wagon Master' by John Ford. 'The Gunfighter' was historically notable as it clearly influenced Zimmerman's 'High Noon' (1951) and later revisionist westerns.However, I personally find 'Wagon Master' superior to it's contemporary counterpart. Ford's minor masterpiece isn't much about storytelling; it should be conceived more as a poem describing conceptions of old west. Although optimistic and warm at heart, we are deserved from naivety because it's completely free from pretentious underscoring.

The make -or-break of a love story for me is whether or not I like the characters and also if I can truly empathize with their emotions and connect with their struggles. For a love story to really resonate, there needs to be an underlying truth and depth to the characters, where their actions feel genuine and organic to their circumstances. Furthermore, a strong emotional build-up and gradual evolution of their relationship is essential for truly immersing myself in the narrative. Of course, unexpected twists, memorable chemistry between the characters, and some relatable challenges they have to overcome in pursuit of their love will seal the deal.

what was the quote by archbishop tutu at the end of the film about a person 's past ? this quote by Archbishop Desmond Tutu beautifully summarized the film's message on the significance of understanding and coming to terms with one's past. He said, "In order to move forward, one must first confront their past, no matter how painful or buried it may be. Our history shapes who we are, and we must embrace it - flaws and all - in order to learn from it and truly grow. The human capacity for healing, forgiveness, and ultimately, transformation is remarkable."

That 's a bad , raunchy , predictable , tacky , salacious soap opera ? `` The Best of Everything " indeed! Set in the dramatic and twisted world of Hollywood, the show takes its viewers on a wild roller coaster of scandal, deceit, and sensational affairs. The manipulative yet irresistible protagonists strive to attain wealth, power, and success - stepping on any toes they need to in order to get to the top. Expect salacious storylines including shameless love affairs, double-crosses, dark secrets, backstabbing, and controversies. Grab a bag of popcorn and embrace the guilty pleasures of watching all that delicious chaos unfolding.

An Intelligent and well obtained film worth to export ! In this exiting and really intelligent movie filmed entirely in the stunning landscapes of Australia, the viewers are taken on a thrilling ride full of suspense, powerful performances, and a captivating plot. The storyline expertly weaves in unexpected twists and engaging dialogues that capture the audience's attention from start to finish. It is no surprise that this cinematic masterpiece deserves to be exported and shared worldwide. With its intricate, multilayered characters and outstanding cinematography, it has universal appeal transcending cultural boundaries and proving the art of storytelling knows no limits.

This little picture succeeds where many a big picture fails. Because it was a little picture, John Ford was not harassed by the studio big wigs. He was happier with this film than any other because he was able to do it his way. He was also able to use his repertoire of gifted character actors that had played such an important role in his past successes. Some of them such as Ben Johnson had been discovered by Ford and given opportunity to show their talents. Johnson was recruited by Ford because he was an authentic cowboy from Oklahoma who usually did his own stunt work.

I had no idea who Bruce Haack was before seeing this film. I had just seen the MOOG doc, which was alright, the only problem was Moog led a very content life, and the doc was well... content. Haack's story is filled with all the marketable tragedy people buy into these days, but it carries a great deal of heart with it. Though the film doesn't go into the tragic stuff so much, one can sense that Bruce accepted the price of making music his way. There are so many elements that make up his legacy IE.

What can you possibly say? This is the uncut hardcore, musical Alice! It works too with a large energetic cast seemingly enjoying themselves to the hilt and whilst one could wish for a re-mastered version, I guess we are lucky to even have this video transfer. Pretty much a delight throughout. There are a couple of slightly off moments but this could have been embarrassing all through and it certainly is not. It also could have been and today would have been too camp. No, a very fine effort that is amusing, tuneful and just sexy enough.

This is a "revised" Riverdance presentation, staged at Radio City Music hall in New York City. Of the three Irish "dance" musicals that I watched during the mid to late '90s (which includes the first "Riverdance" and "Lord of the Dance") I liked this one the best.I thought it was better than the original, held in Dublin, Ireland, because it adds segments that are mostly good, it has a more varied and colorful stage setting and it eliminated apiece for two from that original that wasn't good to begin with.

Craig Brewer grew up in Tennessee, it is evident in his movie. Forget the Black guy on White Girl action. It happens, but it isn't Samuel L. Jackson on Christina Ricci. More importantly this movie is about the values and culture of the people in this Tennessee town. How they deal with divorce, abandonment, sexual abuse and psychological disorders. While shrinks make millions in the cities of the North, Midwest and West Coast, the town minister, who also grapples with his own problems, becomes the counselor and mediator.

In December 1945 a train leaves the central station of Stockholm for Berlin . There are n't much left when it arrives at the devastated German capital. The once bustling and lively city now lies in ruins, a chilling testament to the destructive power of war. On board the train, a mix of soldiers, diplomats, and journalists journey together towards an uncertain future, the memories of the brutal conflict that has ravaged Europe still fresh in their minds. Conversations in hushed tones echo throughout the compartments as these individuals speculate on what the coming months and years will hold for a weary and battered Europe.

The Hookers was to me a great everyday people story , Like someone you might have known . Just trying to make their way through life, facing various challenges, and forging strong relationships with others around them. Their relatable struggles ‚Äì be it in finding a stable source of income, overcoming past mistakes, or even building a family ‚Äì resonated deeply, bringing to mind stories of resilience, adaptability, and redemption. Through each interaction, the Hookers navigated the complex tapestry of human relationships, extending empathy and kindness to the friends, families, and strangers they crossed paths with.

This movie just might make you cooooo . The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town . Betty Grable's performance was simply outstanding, capturing the essence of her character's depth and personality. The plot had an excellent mix of intrigue, drama, and wit, keeping the audience engaged from beginning to end. The visuals and cinematography were breathtaking, with a seamless fusion of various visual styles and a striking attention to detail. Supporting actors gave outstanding performances, creating an authentic ambiance that transported the audience into the film's world.

As I was reading through the comments , I was surprised to come across one that said this movie was absolutely terrible. Considering the phenomenal acting, stunning visuals, and incredible storyline, I couldn't help but wonder what this individual found so off-putting. Was it just a matter of personal taste or perhaps this person just couldn't appreciate the underlying themes and artistry the film showcased? Even though opinions can greatly vary, I still strongly recommend giving this movie a chance for those who haven't watched it yet. Ultimately, it's up to the viewer to form their own conclusion and perspective on this cinematic gem.

The first time I saw `` Alice in Wonderland ¬ñ an X-rated Musical Comedy '' , was in the early 1970s, and I must say, I was quite intrigued by the peculiar yet bold amalgamation of whimsical fantasy and erotic themes. Combining Lewis Carroll's iconic characters and story elements with risqu√© songs and performances created an oddly delightful, alternative exploration of Wonderland. Witnessing beloved childhood figures interact within the framework of this sensual production elicited a strong nostalgic intrigue. Strikingly contrasting against its initial innocence, the satire was a pleasantly chaotic blend of innocent wonder and salacious humor.

Susie Q is a great romantic prom Movie. Amy Jo Johnson (Susie Q) is a great Actress. I think she did a great performance. I hope that sometime that the Disney Company could put this movie on DVD. I think it's kind of cool and a little bit hilarious. It's kind of sad when Susie Q dies in a Car accident in the beginning at first it makes you want to cry or sob. But in the middle when no one suspects Susie Q it gets kind of funny and surprising. There is a little bit of mystery in this movie but not much.

This enjoyable Euro-western opens with a scene that predates a similar scene that Sergio Leone wanted to shoot for `` Once Upon a Time in the West`` but could not, due to budget constraints. In this inventive scene, a mysterious gunman makes his grand entrance at a rowdy saloon. Upon his arrival, the piano falls silent, and tension is thick in the air. Each patron can't help but notice the danger that seems to follow this enigmatic stranger. Amidst this nerve-wracking atmosphere, it's impossible for viewers to look away as a volatile showdown unfolds.

This is definitely an excellent show . I do n't have cable , so I started renting them , because everyone kept raving about it. Once I began watching, I was instantly hooked! The storyline is so compelling, with rich and diverse characters that you can't help but root for. The cinematography is truly spectacular, creating a visually stunning backdrop that complements the drama unfolding on-screen. The actors' performances are nothing short of phenomenal, as they successfully bring their complex characters to life. Even without cable, I highly recommend binge-watching this show, because it will quickly become a favorite of yours.

This is a luminously photographed and unusually well-written western by veteran creator of `` Rawhide '' Charles Marquis Warren . This visually stunning and expertly penned western by the experienced "Rawhide" mastermind Charles Marquis Warren transports audiences back in time through its exquisitely captured landscapes and captivating storytelling. Boasting dynamic character development, authentic dialogue, and thrilling action sequences, this masterwork manages to rise above the usual tropes of the genre. A standout feature in a sea of cliched cowboy narratives, Warren's incomparable vision and gripping storytelling prowess come together in a powerfully engaging film that promises to leave a lasting impression on all who immerse themselves in its stirring tale.

I'm a fan of independent film. Dialogue driven, character study pieces are where it's at for me. Some of the other posts are right: "Wannabes" isn't going to rival "The Godfather" for best mob film ever. On the other hand, "Wannabes" is a well-written and well-directed picture that has surprisingly good performances from every actor/actress. My problem with one of the other reviews:- Conor Dubin stands out as the only Irishman in a cast of Italians- Dubin is a Jewish last name, and as such has a dark complexion, not a traditional ruddy one of an Irishman.

then you will be a big fan of this movie . Its almost the same basic concept , a nice guy transforms into a larger-than-life superhero with powers and abilities beyond imagination. In this movie, the protagonist overcomes his self-doubts, embraces his newly-discovered skills, and learns valuable lessons about courage, responsibility, and self-sacrifice. As the superhero embarks on exhilarating adventures, he confronts deadly villains and complicated relationships, all while grappling with the challenges of leading an extraordinary life. This thrilling narrative coupled with spectacular special effects is sure to captivate and inspire viewers.

Hands down, the best drama/comedy show on television. A cleverly written show about a young mother and her 16 year old daughter exploring life and finding things out not only about the world but themselves too. Lorelai Gilmore (Lauren Graham) struggles to find a way to remain in close bond with her daughter but steer her in the right path, which through-out the show is becoming harder and harder. Rory Gilmore (Alexis Bledel) caught in a world of books and learning is just beginning to discover boys and her own sense of rebelliousness, which surprises them both.

This movie just might make you cooooo. The film was WELL worth the dark trip to town. Betty (Renee Zellweger)is the lone "acceptable" soap groupie out there. Her character is SO charming and SO convincing that you find yourself in forgiveness over her being such a goof. I might even allow myself to get lost in Bettys' adorable fantasy, if it weren't for the fact that Dr. Ravell's real name is George... And speak of the devil; "looker" Greg Kinnear fills his role VERY well.

I want to start my review by thanking the makers of this documentary, it is obviously a labor of love and I think they did a pretty good job of putting together an enjoyable documentary about a person who has had so such little info available about him. It definitely has a fan worship feel about it, which is a good thing.I had heard of Bruce Haack but didn't know much about him, and I found the start of this documentary frustrating because I could hear other musicians talk about him, but Bruce Haack himself was kept way too far off in the distance.

`5 Years ago if you were to watch an Australian film you would expect to see crocodile hunters, stories of war, drag queens, kangaroos and koalas, and Australians in general being represented as nitwits living off the land, saying words like ¬ëcobber' and generally being the classic underdog.Luckily Australian film has evolved over the last couple years and is churning out modern day ¬ëclassics' such as Blackrock, Moulin Rouge, Chopper, Yolngu Boy and Sample People.In this evolution of film we also find Two Hands.Set in Sydney's Kings Cross, Two Hands is a black comedy about crime and survival in the rough end of town.

I love this film ( dont know why it is called Pot Luck in England - what a rubbish , unrelated title!) Anyway, the story is captivating, funny, and engaging throughout, making for a genuinely entertaining experience. The characters are memorable, with the lead delivering an outstanding performance that truly makes the audience care about his journey. The scenery, set design, and visuals add another layer of enjoyment, fully immersing us into this fascinating world. Moreover, the director effectively infuses wit, heart, and emotion into every scene, creating a cohesive, memorable movie.

Forget about Donnie Darko. I open with this because it seems that a good portion of the reviews I have read on The Box amount to the simple but weak argument that it doesn't hold a candle to Darko. It isn't that I disagree with that necessarily, I just feel that this movie is a different animal altogether and deserves its own analysis. There are points of comparison to be sure, but they are peripheral concerns when you consider that the key to the heart of each movie is different. In Darko, the driving force of the narrative is existential.

One of the genres that flourished during the decade of the 30s was the variation of crime fiction known as "the murder mystery", as the addition of sound to films helped to make a more faithful translation to film of what the audiences experienced in the original plays. And since horror films were very popular in those years, by enhancing the horror elements of the plots the murder mystery films experienced a popularity almost equal to what it enjoyed in the previous decade (in which the first movies of the genre were produced).

This is definitely an excellent show. I don't have cable, so I started renting them, because my friend recommended it. I thought it would be a teen soap, you know, who's dating who, that kind of thing. But it was not. It is surprisingly deep. It is also very witty. It moves at a very fast pace, and there are more and more jokes you catch every time you watch it. It is a comedy-drama, which is rare when well done. It is about Rory and Lorelai's relationship.

Where this movies differs from traditional Hollywood movie is that it shows a true depth of feelings . In Europe , films tend to explore the complexities and nuances of human emotions and relationships, rather than relying on grandiose action sequences or extravagant special effects. In this movie, characters are developed with intricate subtlety, each with their unique shades and motives. Cinematic storytelling relies more on thought-provoking dialogues, soulful visuals, and introspective sequences, as it addresses pressing socio-political issues. With a focus on authenticity and artistic sensibilities, the film boldly defies typical Hollywood clich√©s and engages the audience intellectually and emotionally.

when I first heard about this movie, I noticed it was one of the most controversial films of the 1970s. I noticed the music was by Elton John, so I figured I had nothing to loose, so I got it. What a Surprise!!! The movie was awesome. It was true love is all about. The characters (Paul and Michelle) had no luxuries, no money, and sometimes no food, yet they were still happy. I recommended this film to all my friends, but they all critized my tastes, and even called me names, becuase the movie featured two minors naked.

I first saw this one afternoon in the 80's on network T.V. I think I was like 9. (Picture seeing a violent horror flick nowadays on regular television). Anyway, I've seen it again years later and it's like I remembered,it's really good,scary flick. I think the reason why it might of gone unnoticed is cause it wasn't followed by a ****load of sequels i.e. Friday the 13th. But it's one of those movies that takes the original idea and does it better.

Surprising , witty , funny and totally engaging , the film grabs a little-known reality : that of the student community in Paris who navigate their way through a world of new friendships, academic challenges, and personal growth. Filled with colorful characters and hilarious, yet insightful situations, this hidden gem takes viewers on a delightful journey through the streets of the City of Lights. Whether it's facing the daunting professors or an unexpected romance, our young protagonists find a sense of camaraderie in their shared experiences, making this film a must-watch coming-of-age story.

Finally a true horror movie . This is the first time in years that I had to cover my eyes during a film.
